subject: Add an example on keystoneauth Sessions to the doc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 04:10:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst'], 'message': 'Add an example on keystoneauth Sessions to the doc

keystoneauth Session object brings an unified interface of
authentication to a variety of OpenStack services. Some components (e.g.
Nova, Glance) already have an example on their Python API docs. This
patch adds an example on how to create a heat Client instance using
keystoneauth Session API.

Change-Id: Iaa51052ccb4c66aafa11e9bfd6befbd831715110
'}]
commit_message:
Add an example on keystoneauth Sessions to the doc

keystoneauth Session object brings an unified interface of
authentication to a variety of OpenStack services. Some components (e.g.
Nova, Glance) already have an example on their Python API docs. This
patch adds an example on how to create a heat Client instance using
keystoneauth Session API.

Change-Id: Iaa51052ccb4c66aafa11e9bfd6befbd831715110

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-08 01:53:02.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/forms.py'], 'message': 'Disable Glance option to publicize image on Update

The Glance policy file contains a property that controls the ability to
publicize a Glance Image. In Horizon we use this policy check to Hide
the checkbox on Project > Images > Create Image. This is working as
expected.

For Updating an Image we attempt to make the Public checkbox read-only
which isn't enough to disable it.

To test try the following:

1) Update the glance_policy.json file in Horizon (located here
horizon/openstack_dashboard/conf/) to reflect this rule:
...
 "publicize_image": "role:admin",
...
 2) Create a non-admin user and try to Create a new Glance Image
 3) Observe that there is no Public check box.
 4) This is expected.
 5) Continue creating the image.
 6) Once the image is created, Click on Edit Image
 7) Notice that Public checkbox is there and you can select it.
 8) This is not expected.

 Expected Behavior:
 For the Edit Image modal, the checkbox should be disabled like this.

 https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/forms.py#L344

         if not policy.check((("image", "publicize_image"),), request):
                         self.fields['public'].widget =
                         forms.CheckboxInput(
                                         attrs={'readonly': 'readonly',
                                         'disabled': disabled})
Closes-Bug: #1553420

Change-Id: I9c441252f7959e169eedbf432d140f9415d1a32b
'}]
commit_message:
Disable Glance option to publicize image on Update

The Glance policy file contains a property that controls the ability to
publicize a Glance Image. In Horizon we use this policy check to Hide
the checkbox on Project > Images > Create Image. This is working as
expected.

For Updating an Image we attempt to make the Public checkbox read-only
which isn't enough to disable it.

To test try the following:

1) Update the glance_policy.json file in Horizon (located here
horizon/openstack_dashboard/conf/) to reflect this rule:
...
 "publicize_image": "role:admin",
...
 2) Create a non-admin user and try to Create a new Glance Image
 3) Observe that there is no Public check box.
 4) This is expected.
 5) Continue creating the image.
 6) Once the image is created, Click on Edit Image
 7) Notice that Public checkbox is there and you can select it.
 8) This is not expected.

 Expected Behavior:
 For the Edit Image modal, the checkbox should be disabled like this.

 https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/forms.py#L344

         if not policy.check((("image", "publicize_image"),), request):
                         self.fields['public'].widget =
                         forms.CheckboxInput(
                                         attrs={'readonly': 'readonly',
                                         'disabled': disabled})
Closes-Bug: #1553420

Change-Id: I9c441252f7959e169eedbf432d140f9415d1a32b

subject: Construct exceptions before passing to retryrequest
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 00:26:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/test_db_api.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/test_driver.py', 'neutron/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/db_api.py', 'neutron/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/driver.py'], 'message': "Construct exceptions before passing to retryrequest

The IP allocation failure constructions weren't being constructed
before being passed to RetryRequest so they would fail to be reraised
after the retries were exhausted.

This patch just constructs them and adjusts a few of the unit tests
to execute the full retry life-cycle.

Closes-Bug: #1555387
Change-Id: I1c1ea488886ee3f4790eaa53911ea5845f327334
"}]
commit_message:
Construct exceptions before passing to retryrequest

The IP allocation failure constructions weren't being constructed
before being passed to RetryRequest so they would fail to be reraised
after the retries were exhausted.

This patch just constructs them and adjusts a few of the unit tests
to execute the full retry life-cycle.

Closes-Bug: #1555387
Change-Id: I1c1ea488886ee3f4790eaa53911ea5845f327334

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-01-23 05:55:53.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxscsi.py', 'os_brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py', 'os_brick/exception.py'], 'message': "Improve remove_multipath_device() for linuxscsi

When use remove_multipath_device() to remove an iscsi multipath
device, it do nothing when it find that the mpath_dev is none,
I think it should raise an error here for the following reason:

When find_multipath_device() method failed to get the multipath
device name for some reasons(for example: it failed to run the
'multipath -l' command), it will return a None value. In this
case, the multipath device will not be detached, but the nova
detach program just don't know this, so it do next step to remove
the iscsi target. This lead iscsid disconnected to the target.

In this case, the device paths still exist in the system, but the
iscsi target is removed. This will cause many errors, such as: the
multipathd will set the device to offline status, the iscsid will
report connect error, and the kernel will report I/O error.

I have encountered this problem, for more information, please see
the bug message which I have reported.

Change-Id: I7fd2f951ad348a2b1ffc36a99385671eb24f0dc4
Co-Authored-By: Felix Ma <maqi@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Closes-Bug: #1519405
"}]
commit_message:
Improve remove_multipath_device() for linuxscsi

When use remove_multipath_device() to remove an iscsi multipath
device, it do nothing when it find that the mpath_dev is none,
I think it should raise an error here for the following reason:

When find_multipath_device() method failed to get the multipath
device name for some reasons(for example: it failed to run the
'multipath -l' command), it will return a None value. In this
case, the multipath device will not be detached, but the nova
detach program just don't know this, so it do next step to remove
the iscsi target. This lead iscsid disconnected to the target.

In this case, the device paths still exist in the system, but the
iscsi target is removed. This will cause many errors, such as: the
multipathd will set the device to offline status, the iscsid will
report connect error, and the kernel will report I/O error.

I have encountered this problem, for more information, please see
the bug message which I have reported.

Change-Id: I7fd2f951ad348a2b1ffc36a99385671eb24f0dc4
Co-Authored-By: Felix Ma <maqi@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Closes-Bug: #1519405

subject: Add Baymodel fixed_subnet filed support in client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 08:28:05.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/v1/baymodels_shell.py', 'magnumclient/tests/v1/test_baymodels_shell.py', 'magnumclient/v1/baymodels.py', 'magnumclient/tests/v1/test_baymodels.py'], 'message': "Add Baymodel fixed_subnet filed support in client

In current Magnum code, Baymodel's 'fixed_network' is mapped to heat's
'fixed_network_cidr'. So 'fixed_network' actually means 'fixed_network_cidr',
or more precisely 'fixed_subnet'. For heat stack creation, it need
create a new fixed network and fixed subnet. So, give 'fixed_network'
the role it should be, and add a new field 'fixed_subnet' to Baymodel,
and then use 'fixed_subnet' to take the place of current 'fixed_network'.
This patch add Baymodel fixed_subnet support in MagnumClient.

Change-Id: I50103d4b2b1a3e32f5f9a75abb63aea94d6d47e4
Partial-Bug: #1519748
Depends-On: Ia74ed924b3058b4891775f34f1b9624774c02ddb
"}]
commit_message:
Add Baymodel fixed_subnet filed support in client

In current Magnum code, Baymodel's 'fixed_network' is mapped to heat's
'fixed_network_cidr'. So 'fixed_network' actually means 'fixed_network_cidr',
or more precisely 'fixed_subnet'. For heat stack creation, it need
create a new fixed network and fixed subnet. So, give 'fixed_network'
the role it should be, and add a new field 'fixed_subnet' to Baymodel,
and then use 'fixed_subnet' to take the place of current 'fixed_network'.
This patch add Baymodel fixed_subnet support in MagnumClient.

Change-Id: I50103d4b2b1a3e32f5f9a75abb63aea94d6d47e4
Partial-Bug: #1519748
Depends-On: Ia74ed924b3058b4891775f34f1b9624774c02ddb

commit_message:
Forbid update subscription to duplicate

Now if users update a subscription in a queue, it doesn't check the
legality of the new subscriber. We should forbid update subscription to
duplicate and return 409 response in such case.

This patch modifies Redis and MongoDB storage controllers and API v2.
It also adds unit tests for them.

The functional test will be updated in zaqar client.

APIimpact
Closes-Bug: #1545548
Closes-Bug: #1547131
Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Eva Balycheva <ubershy@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I28fe7a114860488c503642417690bf5bfbd99678

commit_message:
Fix tables.js error when update row set multi_select=false

We set multi_select=false, and the table have update row,
then the horizon give the error:
TypeError: $row.find(...)[0] is undefined

This patch fixs it.

Similar to handoff_delete setting in swift. Allows you to run replicator
with a "-q" flag which will remove out of place paritions if they are

commit_message:
go: add quorum delete to replicator

Similar to handoff_delete setting in swift. Allows you to run replicator
with a "-q" flag which will remove out of place paritions if they are
successfully replicated on len(primary_nodes)/2 + 1 primary nodes.

you can also set `quorum_delete=true` in the [object-replicator]
section of the config

Change-Id: I76d6ad5dd1d1e6ecaec5e754f30120d92889078b

commit_message:
Refactor security group create to use SDK

Refactored the 'os security group create' command to use the SDK
when neutron is enabled, but continue to use the nova client
when nova network is enabled.

Added a release note for the change in security group rules output
due to Network v2. The tenant_id column name was fixed to align
with the 'os security group show' command.

Change-Id: Ib29df42edcddcc73a123fff6a64743a6bfcb7fbf
Partial-Bug: #1519511
Implements: blueprint neutron-client

commit_message:
Refactor security group show to use SDK

Refactored the 'os security group show' command to use the SDK
when neutron is enabled, but continue to use the nova client
when nova network is enabled.

Added a release note for the change in security group rules output
due to Network v2. The column names remain unchanged to maintain
backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I25233ddb8115d18b8b88affb3de13346084a339d
Partial-Bug: #1519511
Implements: blueprint neutron-client

commit_message:
Refresh the networks on ajax update

If using neutron, the ajax will query the last status from
nova which could be out of date, so any floating ips
added wont show up unless you refresh the whole page.

Change-Id: Iad1684d1a2fb677ee8850a98c8219794698722e3
Closes-Bug: 1505935
(cherry picked from commit b59ebcfaac67632520968353e61568c7aa637adc)

subject: Remove bandit.yaml in favor of defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 19:26:35.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/common/urlfetch.py', 'magnum/cmd/api.py', 'bandit.yaml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove bandit.yaml in favor of defaults

* Remove bandit.yaml so bandit just uses internal defaults. Results
  in much less maintenance.
* Raise the severity level of the scan to just medium and high
* Added nosec to line that makes use of file:// scheme. That support
  should probably be droppped at a later time.
* Removed a misleading log message noting what address it was
  serving on. Bandit also flagged this as a potential security issue
  serving on 0.0.0.0.

Change-Id: I3e08e462255f7b4ba8405d69f5843ed3c001d055
'}]
commit_message:
Remove bandit.yaml in favor of defaults

* Remove bandit.yaml so bandit just uses internal defaults. Results
  in much less maintenance.
* Raise the severity level of the scan to just medium and high
* Added nosec to line that makes use of file:// scheme. That support
  should probably be droppped at a later time.
* Removed a misleading log message noting what address it was
  serving on. Bandit also flagged this as a potential security issue
  serving on 0.0.0.0.

Change-Id: I3e08e462255f7b4ba8405d69f5843ed3c001d055

commit_message:
Mark trustee_domain_admin_password secret

The trustee_domain_admin_password config option needs to be marked
secret in order to avoid leaking of the password into the logs.

Closes-Bug: #1555276

commit_message:
Allow the vnc server to bind on IPv6 address on computes

Currently the vnc server on the compute nodes binds on 0.0.0.0.
which only works with IPv4 addresses, it breaks connectivity with
IPv6 addressing.

This fixes https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1300678.

Change-Id: Id642d224fb3c62f786453dc684634adca1c2c09d
Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>

subject: Launch Instance Wizard - Avail items count doesn't update
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-03-09 23:10:13.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/widgets/transfer-table/transfer-table.controller.spec.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/transfer-table/transfer-table.controller.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/source/source.controller.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/source/source.controller.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/transfer-table/transfer-table.module.js'], 'message': "Launch Instance Wizard - Avail items count doesn't update

In the Angular Launch Instance Wizard, when you change the
the boot source, the Available items count does not update
correctly. Example: Boot Source is set to Image by default and
the Available items Count is correct. Change the boot source.
The count does not update. Also, when you change back to
Image, the previously allocated item no longer exists.

Also fix tiny typo.

Change-Id: I647b31c7a280af4e10040fb27b4436d489fd8163
Closes-Bug: #1489618
"}]
commit_message:
Launch Instance Wizard - Avail items count doesn't update

In the Angular Launch Instance Wizard, when you change the
the boot source, the Available items count does not update
correctly. Example: Boot Source is set to Image by default and
the Available items Count is correct. Change the boot source.
The count does not update. Also, when you change back to
Image, the previously allocated item no longer exists.

Also fix tiny typo.

Change-Id: I647b31c7a280af4e10040fb27b4436d489fd8163
Closes-Bug: #1489618

commit_message:
Use "command -v" instead of "which" to find path

If /usr/bin/which is not available, the current code
doesn't detect i.e. /usr/bin/zypper . Using "command -v" solved
the problem.

Change-Id: I1c281c3184d69cd9dc2418295b6a392d8e5693e0

subject: Also detected failed packages in dnf/yum wrapper
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 04:17:27.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': 'Also detected failed packages in dnf/yum wrapper

As seen in [1]; dnf can output a "Failed:" section when installation
issues with a package are detected.  This does not, however, trigger
an exit failure code when running with "-y".  So add this to our
checking wrapper.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/49/280449/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-platform-fedora23-nv/dc70ca8/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2016-02-28_22_42_45_145

Change-Id: I12f7b3bc9e9cf5a97114082d3a634a42742843d5
'}]
commit_message:
Also detected failed packages in dnf/yum wrapper

As seen in [1]; dnf can output a "Failed:" section when installation
issues with a package are detected.  This does not, however, trigger
an exit failure code when running with "-y".  So add this to our
checking wrapper.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/49/280449/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-platform-fedora23-nv/dc70ca8/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2016-02-28_22_42_45_145

Change-Id: I12f7b3bc9e9cf5a97114082d3a634a42742843d5

subject: Ensure there is checkbox before accessing it's properties
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-10 20:35:59.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.tables.js'], 'message': "Ensure there is checkbox before accessing it's properties

Currently js code, that updates ajax rows in horizon tables expects each
row to have a checkbox. Otherwise it throws an error. This commit adds a
check, that ensures, that there is a multi-select checkbox before
accessing it's properties, to allow non-multi-select tables have ajax
rows.

Change-Id: I665df75fe09da149c5401620df188f738845a016
Closes-Bug: #1554087
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure there is checkbox before accessing it's properties

Currently js code, that updates ajax rows in horizon tables expects each
row to have a checkbox. Otherwise it throws an error. This commit adds a
check, that ensures, that there is a multi-select checkbox before
accessing it's properties, to allow non-multi-select tables have ajax
rows.

Change-Id: I665df75fe09da149c5401620df188f738845a016
Closes-Bug: #1554087

subject: keystone/wsgi: bind on local IP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 16:41:54.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "keystone/wsgi: bind on local IP

Instead of using default value from puppetlabs-apache and use 0.0.0.0
binding, let's use local IP like it was done before when running
eventlet.

Also cleaning some useless parameters for keystone binding, that are not
used anymore since we run WSGI.

Change-Id: Id84b05e7a855d1452236c89224eed507c58b03a8
(cherry picked from commit 5d020c717ccc9c4b8758de105816ab6a108dd146)
"}]
commit_message:
keystone/wsgi: bind on local IP

Instead of using default value from puppetlabs-apache and use 0.0.0.0
binding, let's use local IP like it was done before when running
eventlet.

Also cleaning some useless parameters for keystone binding, that are not
used anymore since we run WSGI.

Change-Id: Id84b05e7a855d1452236c89224eed507c58b03a8
(cherry picked from commit 5d020c717ccc9c4b8758de105816ab6a108dd146)

subject: Unscoped PKI token should no longer be hashed multiple times.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-23 15:16:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/user.py'], 'message': 'Unscoped PKI token should no longer be hashed multiple times.

When token hashing is used with pki tokens, the unscoped token
gets re-hashed when switching project. This fix checks
if the unscoped token needs to be hashed before doing so.

The project list operation when switching project in horizon
failed because the unscoped token could for example be an
md5 of an md5.

Change-Id: I64684ca251eb4d0c6164e58c078cf7d132eb3cc1
Closes-Bug: #1487372
(cherry picked from commit 5ab3908cff64fa5b5a5bd5ea4877c42096172dd3)
'}]
commit_message:
Unscoped PKI token should no longer be hashed multiple times.

When token hashing is used with pki tokens, the unscoped token
gets re-hashed when switching project. This fix checks
if the unscoped token needs to be hashed before doing so.

The project list operation when switching project in horizon
failed because the unscoped token could for example be an
md5 of an md5.

Change-Id: I64684ca251eb4d0c6164e58c078cf7d132eb3cc1
Closes-Bug: #1487372
(cherry picked from commit 5ab3908cff64fa5b5a5bd5ea4877c42096172dd3)

commit_message:
Hide load balancers v2 panel if not enabled

This adds the "allowed" check to the Load Balancers panel so that
it's not displayed if the extension is not enabled or if the horizon
config explicitly disables it.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: I7b384c2f78aa0aa622d23b8b4ee317dd99f396e0

subject: Do not allow deleting a listener that has a default pool
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-10 20:54:05.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas_dashboard/static/dashboard/project/lbaasv2/listeners/actions/delete/delete.action.service.spec.js', 'neutron_lbaas_dashboard/static/dashboard/project/lbaasv2/listeners/actions/delete/delete.action.service.js'], 'message': 'Do not allow deleting a listener that has a default pool

This change adds checks to the listener delete service to not allow deleting
a listener that currently has a default pool associated with it.  In the case
of the Delete batch action, an error message is displayed, while the delete
row action is simply just not displayed/available if a pool exists.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: Iddee0a5cee5ebbead9438a2add8ebcf57f69d348
'}]
commit_message:
Do not allow deleting a listener that has a default pool

This change adds checks to the listener delete service to not allow deleting
a listener that currently has a default pool associated with it.  In the case
of the Delete batch action, an error message is displayed, while the delete
row action is simply just not displayed/available if a pool exists.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: Iddee0a5cee5ebbead9438a2add8ebcf57f69d348

subject: Use puppet parameter for Heat notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 20:34:47.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Use puppet parameter for Heat notifications

When the original change merged, the puppet module change to expose
the notification_driver as a top-level param had not been backported.
It looks like it now has, so this is breaking all of our stable

Change-Id: I5c50e4c458ed9f4ad37114550a22d297593af0f6
Closes-Bug: 1555803
'}]
commit_message:
Use puppet parameter for Heat notifications

When the original change merged, the puppet module change to expose
the notification_driver as a top-level param had not been backported.
It looks like it now has, so this is breaking all of our stable
deployments because the config option is being set twice.

Change-Id: I5c50e4c458ed9f4ad37114550a22d297593af0f6
Closes-Bug: 1555803

commit_message:
remove oslo-incubator apiclient

The exceptions from oslo-incubator's apiclient  has been deprecated
since v0.7.1, We can use keystone keystoneclient.exceptions instead.

We can also remove the rest of the apiclient from oslo-incubator
since we do not depend on it internally, and has been deprecated
for just as long.

Change-Id: Ieffdc0da7d8a877be5cfe04a1ef9967cc24487c5

commit_message:
Fix phantomjs package error and update eslint-config-openstack

Patches prior to this failed the `npm run lint` and `gulp unit` gate
tests due to a new versioning of eslint-config-openstack and renaming
of the phantomjs browser to `phantomjs-prebuilt`. This patches updates
the necessary deps in package.json so that gate tests can now run
successfully.

Change-Id: I8ad54b29d91801d09991496b1e5eb90680ace8e3

subject: Set apt sources to use a configured list of components
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}, {'_account_id': 15993, 'name': 'Amy Marrich', 'display_name': 'Amy Marrich (spotz)', 'email': 'amy@demarco.com', 'username': 'amarrich'}, {'_account_id': 19814, 'name': 'Travis Truman (automagically)', 'email': 'travis_truman@cable.comcast.com', 'username': 'trumant'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-09 17:23:22.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/lxc_hosts/templates/sources.list.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/apt-sources-config-8e047a75ac555663.yaml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_hosts/defaults/main.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/apt-sources.list.j2'], 'message': "Set apt sources to use a configured list of components

re: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/086000.html

Ubuntu has 4 different 'components' - main, universe, multiverse and
restricted:
 - Main: Officially supported software.
 - Restricted: Supported software that is not available under a completely
               free license.
 - Universe: Community maintained software, i.e. not officially supported
             software.
 - Multiverse: Software that is not free.

Practically speaking there should be nothing particularly useful to
OpenStack-Ansible in Restricted or Multiverse - it's mostly software for
desktop users.

This patch introduces a new variable 'lxc_container_template_apt_components'
which is a list of the components to configure in the apt sources list. The
default list includes all the components to ensure that existing deployments
do not have any changes to the configuration implemented.

This patch also introduces a new variable 'bootstrap_host_apt_components'
which is a list of the components to configure in the apt sources list for
the AIO and gate testing specifically. The default list does not include the
unnecessary components.

Backport notes:

This is a combined backport of https://review.openstack.org/278033 and
https://review.openstack.org/278037, but with the lxc_hosts role defaults
adjusted in order to protect existing production deployments.

Change-Id: I0eef6454d273f5ba1977a68151fbf6103ff3ed8d
"}]
commit_message:
Set apt sources to use a configured list of components

re: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/086000.html

Ubuntu has 4 different 'components' - main, universe, multiverse and
restricted:
 - Main: Officially supported software.
 - Restricted: Supported software that is not available under a completely
               free license.
 - Universe: Community maintained software, i.e. not officially supported
             software.
 - Multiverse: Software that is not free.

Practically speaking there should be nothing particularly useful to
OpenStack-Ansible in Restricted or Multiverse - it's mostly software for
desktop users.

This patch introduces a new variable 'lxc_container_template_apt_components'
which is a list of the components to configure in the apt sources list. The
default list includes all the components to ensure that existing deployments
do not have any changes to the configuration implemented.

This patch also introduces a new variable 'bootstrap_host_apt_components'
which is a list of the components to configure in the apt sources list for
the AIO and gate testing specifically. The default list does not include the
unnecessary components.

Backport notes:

This is a combined backport of https://review.openstack.org/278033 and
https://review.openstack.org/278037, but with the lxc_hosts role defaults
adjusted in order to protect existing production deployments.

Change-Id: I0eef6454d273f5ba1977a68151fbf6103ff3ed8d

subject: Allow a list of files to be copied into the container cache
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 18:28:28.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/container-cache-file-copy-5ce4a16ded8fb1da.yaml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_hosts/tasks/lxc_cache_preparation.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_hosts/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Allow a list of files to be copied into the container cache

In order to better make use of OpenStack-CI's resources (apt mirrors, etc)
we need to be able to copy configuration files which have been implemented
on the host image into the containers.

This patch provides a facility to do this in a way that provides a new
facility for deployers to use, doesn't affect existing production
environments and is easy for us to consume in gate testing.

A new variable called 'lxc_container_cache_files' is implemented, which
is a list of dictionaries specifying the location of the file on the
deployment system, where to put it in the container cache, and what
attributes to assign the file.

An example of how to use it is included in the role's defaults as a comment.

Note:
This is a backport of https://review.openstack.org/289898 without the test
bits as the Liberty branch has no facility to use them.

Change-Id: Ia76b3a791239a07db1cb93636b7d1e23a6a6851c
"}]
commit_message:
Allow a list of files to be copied into the container cache

In order to better make use of OpenStack-CI's resources (apt mirrors, etc)
we need to be able to copy configuration files which have been implemented
on the host image into the containers.

This patch provides a facility to do this in a way that provides a new
facility for deployers to use, doesn't affect existing production
environments and is easy for us to consume in gate testing.

A new variable called 'lxc_container_cache_files' is implemented, which
is a list of dictionaries specifying the location of the file on the
deployment system, where to put it in the container cache, and what
attributes to assign the file.

An example of how to use it is included in the role's defaults as a comment.

Note:
This is a backport of https://review.openstack.org/289898 without the test
bits as the Liberty branch has no facility to use them.

Change-Id: Ia76b3a791239a07db1cb93636b7d1e23a6a6851c

commit_message:
Fix BaseRegion and TabbedFormRegion initialization

Now `src_elem` and `_default_src_locator` properties work in
conjunction - if both are specified, `_default_src_locator` is being
searched in the provided `src_elem`. This fixes the issue of binding
table tabs instead of form tabs on the same page.

Co-Authored-By: Georgy Dyuldin <gdyuldin@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Id91d82062d4145f37c7b1a33fca56bf7e441aa6e
Closes-Bug: #1549632

commit_message:
Test tag against schema to check length

This bug checks the tag against the v2 schema so that if the tag is
too long this is picked up and a 400 in returned along with the schema
message. The schema was used so if it ever changes this will evolve
with it.

Closes-Bug: 1488174
Change-Id: Ibb8250851b1b716d8198ad1a4ca04b7d6a4d40dc

commit_message:
remove CLI from keystoneclient

the CLI has been deprecated for a long time, and many docs and
install guides recommend using OSC instead of `keystone`.

- removes CLI
- removes man page from docs
- removes CLI tests
- removes `bootstrap` from contrib
- removes entrypoint from setup.cfg

implements bp: remove-cli

Change-Id: Icbe15814bc4faf33f513f9654440068795eae807

If a plugin tries to give invalid valueMeta for a Measurement, the
API will reject it. Since the agent batches measurements together,
this will cause rejection of the whole batch so it is better to
just reject these measurements before sending them. It also makes
it easier to determine which plugin is sending the invalid measurements

Change-Id: Id9d14de5e7ad6a11d0c8b284a3cd59bd9ecfafbd
'}]
commit_message:
Validate valueMeta for measurement

If a plugin tries to give invalid valueMeta for a Measurement, the
API will reject it. Since the agent batches measurements together,
this will cause rejection of the whole batch so it is better to
just reject these measurements before sending them. It also makes
it easier to determine which plugin is sending the invalid measurements

Change-Id: Id9d14de5e7ad6a11d0c8b284a3cd59bd9ecfafbd

commit_message:
Enable predictable IPs on non-controllers

For the external loadbalancer work, we added the ability to specify
fixed ips for controller nodes on all network isolation networks.
In order to allow users full control over the placement and ip
addresses of deployed nodes, we need to be able to do the same thing
for the other node types.

Change-Id: I3ea91768b2ea3a40287f2f3cdb823c23533cf290

subject: Fix tests to work under both pymsysql 0.6.2 and 0.7.x
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-01 16:25:17.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': "Fix tests to work under both pymsysql 0.6.2 and 0.7.x

In 0.6.2, the exc.statement and exc.params were as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%s, %s)'
exc.params = {tuple} (1, 2)

In 0.7.1, the exc.statement and exc.params are as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%(id)s, %(foo_id)s)'
exc.params = {dict} {'id': 1, 'foo_id': 2}

So the easiest thing to support both is to use string interpolation
and then check if they are equal. This approach works for both py34
and py27 as well. Note that we still have to test the old way for
sqlite which has (?, ?) in the SQL statement.

Closes-Bug: #1533861
Change-Id: Iab9f0e4b4dd337363dd7e705c1155f3f6517b404
(cherry picked from commit 543d577613a5ccc12f4482d9e2f9ce1f29db21b4)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tests to work under both pymsysql 0.6.2 and 0.7.x

In 0.6.2, the exc.statement and exc.params were as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%s, %s)'
exc.params = {tuple} (1, 2)

In 0.7.1, the exc.statement and exc.params are as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%(id)s, %(foo_id)s)'
exc.params = {dict} {'id': 1, 'foo_id': 2}

So the easiest thing to support both is to use string interpolation
and then check if they are equal. This approach works for both py34
and py27 as well. Note that we still have to test the old way for
sqlite which has (?, ?) in the SQL statement.

Closes-Bug: #1533861
Change-Id: Iab9f0e4b4dd337363dd7e705c1155f3f6517b404
(cherry picked from commit 543d577613a5ccc12f4482d9e2f9ce1f29db21b4)

commit_message:
Drop the use of magic openstack project_id

When we put validation into the project_id in urls we had to expand
the default set of allowed values to include 'openstack' and
'fake'. This cleans up all the instances of 'openstack' in the
functional tests, and api samples, and instead uses a constant string
which looks like a real project_id.

We need a stable project_id and not a sentinel otherwise the samples
will be arbitrarily changes on every update.

Change-Id: I1099fd43d2374abd1658b0917765d5375c4b8d1d

commit_message:
plugins/xenserver: Resolve PEP8 issues

Before enabling PEP8 checks for these files, the actual PEP8 issues
need to be resolved. There are a number of "types" of issues that need
to be fixed:

* E112 expected an indented block
* E241 multiple spaces after ','
* E265 block comment should start with '# '
* E302 expected 2 blank lines, found 1
* H102 Apache 2.0 license header not found
* H237 module module is removed in Python 3
* H303 No wildcard (*) import.
* H404 multi line docstring should start without a leading new line
* H231 Python 3.x incompatible 'except x,y:' construct
* F403 from module import *' used; unable to detect undefined names
* F841 local variable 'name' is assigned to but never used
* N344 Use six.iteritems() instead of dict.iteritems().

The fixes for the above are all pretty self-explanatory, but there is
one exception. The 'N344' issues are not ignorable due to how the
"hacking" check is implemented. Rather than ignoring them, skip the
issue altogether by replacing 'iteritems' with 'items'. The difference
in memory usage that this incurs should not be noticable.

Change-Id: Ie26e3daca3b408c9ea43613bcb9996618b9abc69
Partial-Bug: #1302831

VMware Vsphere Declarative polling spec

This is a change to introduce code-free metering for Vsphere inspector and
to enable user to select the meters for which data needs to be collected.

Implements: blueprint vmware-vsphere-declarative-polling

By versioning deletes we can use elasticsearch's in built mechanism
to avoid accidentally resurrecting deleted documents.

This patch adds versioning to the delete helper code, and extracts a
version from the various plugin notification payloads.

It also increases the default delete GC time to 5 minutes from 1 minute

Implements-blueprint: es-deletion-journal
"}]
commit_message:
Version deletes and inc default GC delete time

By versioning deletes we can use elasticsearch's in built mechanism
to avoid accidentally resurrecting deleted documents.

This patch adds versioning to the delete helper code, and extracts a
version from the various plugin notification payloads.

It also increases the default delete GC time to 5 minutes from 1 minute
(configurable).

Change-Id: I7bde5a496c01ffeb17a6560d5c3572c51b1be141
Implements-blueprint: es-deletion-journal

commit_message:
Pass target in enforce

As described in [1], we should pass bay or baymodel as target in
enforce. Otherwise we can not user generic-checks. We need this
check for some situations, for example only allow the user who
creates a bay can delete the bay.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.policy/api/
oslo_policy.html#generic-checks

Change-Id: I60f8870dd1a2bb07efbadf5f16a453f0a2e0cb3d
Closes-Bug: #1553914

subject: Fix Order Quota Enforcement to Account For Secrets Quota
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 21:22:38.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/api/controllers/orders.py', '.gitignore', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_quotas_enforce.py'], 'message': 'Fix Order Quota Enforcement to Account For Secrets Quota

Currently, if secrets quota is not infinite, it is possible to create
(secrets quota + orders quota) number of secrets via order creation,
because order quota enforcer does not take into account whether the
secrets quota is full or not.

This fix enforces the secrets quota in addition to the orders quota when
creating an order.

Now, it will not be possible to create > secrets quota number of secrets
through order creation.

Change-Id: I794fc7579c8f9c67d00eb64adbb332b008a42ba0
Closes-Bug: #1535404
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Order Quota Enforcement to Account For Secrets Quota

Currently, if secrets quota is not infinite, it is possible to create
(secrets quota + orders quota) number of secrets via order creation,
because order quota enforcer does not take into account whether the
secrets quota is full or not.

This fix enforces the secrets quota in addition to the orders quota when
creating an order.

Now, it will not be possible to create > secrets quota number of secrets
through order creation.

Change-Id: I794fc7579c8f9c67d00eb64adbb332b008a42ba0
Closes-Bug: #1535404

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-29 11:27:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "Remove unused columns from Service ORM model

rpc_available_version and object_available_version columns were part of
previous design of our RPC API compatibility layer. We've decided to go
in a little different direction so these two are currently unused.

With our live-schema-upgrades guidelines (related to rolling upgrades
support) it's a lot easier to readd something to the DB than to drop it.
Let's take the chance to actually drop these unused DB columns in early
Newton. To do that we need to remove them from the SQLAlchemy model in
Mitaka and this commit does so.

Change-Id: I3b7588214863ed008a0783167580953c22f58e99
Related-Blueprint: rpc-object-compatibility
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused columns from Service ORM model

rpc_available_version and object_available_version columns were part of
previous design of our RPC API compatibility layer. We've decided to go
in a little different direction so these two are currently unused.

With our live-schema-upgrades guidelines (related to rolling upgrades
support) it's a lot easier to readd something to the DB than to drop it.
Let's take the chance to actually drop these unused DB columns in early
Newton. To do that we need to remove them from the SQLAlchemy model in
Mitaka and this commit does so.

Change-Id: I3b7588214863ed008a0783167580953c22f58e99
Related-Blueprint: rpc-object-compatibility

subject: Fix cinder type ensurabilty
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10489, 'name': 'Bartosz Kupidura', 'email': 'bkupidura@mirantis.com', 'username': 'bkupidura'}, {'_account_id': 13344, 'name': 'Oleksiy Molchanov', 'email': 'omolchanov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'cvieri.lviv'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17730, 'name': 'Maciej Relewicz', 'email': 'mrelewicz@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mrelewicz'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-10 00:04:58.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/.fixtures.yml', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-cinder/create_cinder_types_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/spec/defines/osnailyfacter_openstack_manage_cinder_types_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/openstack/manage_cinder_types.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/openstack-cinder/create_cinder_types.pp'], 'message': "Fix cinder type ensurabilty

This change adds additional logic to our cinder type management to
allow for the automatic cleanup of cinder types when they are no longer
configured. Previously we were only creating types and when we unlock
the ability to reconfigure an environment, we would leave the old cinder
types still configured. A user would have to manually cleanup the cinder
types via the 'cinder type-delete' command.  This change replaces the
usage of the cinder::type resource with the new cinder_type provider
that allows for ensure => 'absent'. The old cinder::type has also been
deprecated so this removes its usage.

With this change we are also moving the resource we were using to a
proper resource with tests under the osnailyfacter module.

Change-Id: Ib547c4c76b89cab10ccbcefc021f62b621a79c08
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-ensurability
Related-Bug: #1555360
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder type ensurabilty

This change adds additional logic to our cinder type management to
allow for the automatic cleanup of cinder types when they are no longer
configured. Previously we were only creating types and when we unlock
the ability to reconfigure an environment, we would leave the old cinder
types still configured. A user would have to manually cleanup the cinder
types via the 'cinder type-delete' command.  This change replaces the
usage of the cinder::type resource with the new cinder_type provider
that allows for ensure => 'absent'. The old cinder::type has also been
deprecated so this removes its usage.

With this change we are also moving the resource we were using to a
proper resource with tests under the osnailyfacter module.

Change-Id: Ib547c4c76b89cab10ccbcefc021f62b621a79c08
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-ensurability
Related-Bug: #1555360

'}]
commit_message:
Replace ConfigParser with six.moves.configparser

ConfigParser is available in python2 but not in python3.

commit_message:
Added extra_resources field to ComputeNode

The field "extra_resources" is a JSON string contained within the
ComputeNode model.  However it was not defined within the ComputeNode
object itself.  While this field is not currently used anywhere else
in the project, it can be utilized by custom schedules

Exposed extra_resources in ComputeNode object and tied it in to
the ComputeNode model.

Changed tests to reflect added field

Change-Id: I7042c453028626619e1216ef00373b9c189f2740
Closes-Bug:1533322

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4330, 'name': 'Tomas Sedovic', 'email': 'tsedovic@redhat.com', 'username': 'tomas-8c8'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7471, 'name': 'Richard Su', 'email': 'rwsu@redhat.com', 'username': 'rwsu'}, {'_account_id': 7582, 'name': 'Jan Provaznik', 'email': 'jan.provaznik@gmail.com', 'username': 'jprovazn'}, {'_account_id': 8652, 'name': 'Attila Darazs', 'email': 'adarazs@redhat.com', 'username': 'adarazs'}, {'_account_id': 13294, 'name': 'Javier Peña', 'email': 'jpena@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpena'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-03-10 17:21:18.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/compute.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix vncproxy_host for IPv6

https://review.openstack.org/268356 can cause issues in IPv6
environments. It generates the following Hiera data:

nova::vncproxy::common::vncproxy_host: [2001:db8:fd00:1000::10]

which fails due to the brackets. Making sure there are no brackets
in nova_vncproxy_host makes it work for both the IP case and when
using DNS names.

Change-Id: Iafe18f042725eb9419d97cd674c4b9a1a895b187
'}]
commit_message:
Fix vncproxy_host for IPv6

https://review.openstack.org/268356 can cause issues in IPv6
environments. It generates the following Hiera data:

nova::vncproxy::common::vncproxy_host: [2001:db8:fd00:1000::10]

which fails due to the brackets. Making sure there are no brackets
in nova_vncproxy_host makes it work for both the IP case and when
using DNS names.

Change-Id: Iafe18f042725eb9419d97cd674c4b9a1a895b187

django-openstack-auth-kerberos is a stable plugin for
django_openstack_auth it will be updated infrequently.
independent is a better fitting release model rather

Change-Id: Icf398bfa848805f95f8fa85da0861e243e4105e8
'}]
commit_message:
Change release django-openstack-auth-kerberos

django-openstack-auth-kerberos is a stable plugin for
django_openstack_auth it will be updated infrequently.
independent is a better fitting release model rather
than the present cycle-with-intermediary. Additionally,
the use of stable-branches is unnecessary.

Change-Id: Icf398bfa848805f95f8fa85da0861e243e4105e8

subject: Drop charm supplied paste.ini configurations
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-10 11:46:12.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/glance_utils.py', 'templates/icehouse/glance-api-paste.ini', 'templates/icehouse/glance-registry-paste.ini', 'templates/mitaka/glance-registry-paste.ini', 'unit_tests/test_glance_relations.py', 'unit_tests/test_glance_utils.py', 'hooks/glance_relations.py', 'templates/kilo/glance-api-paste.ini', 'templates/kilo/glance-registry-paste.ini', 'templates/mitaka/glance-api-paste.ini', 'unit_tests/test_utils.py', 'tests/basic_deployment.py', 'hooks/upgrade-charm'], 'message': 'Drop charm supplied paste.ini configurations

The glance-api-paste.ini and glance-registry-paste.ini configuration
files provided as part of the glance packages should be used; drop
charm templates and associated code paths.

This was required in early OpenStack versions where keystone auth
credentials where rendered into the paste ini file.

Existing deployments will go through a upgrade step to replace the
previously provided paste files from the charm with those provided
by the glance-api and glance-registry packages.

Change-Id: I016b8cb7823b98e8dffa91b3b427ed88a7b619bc
'}]
commit_message:
Drop charm supplied paste.ini configurations

The glance-api-paste.ini and glance-registry-paste.ini configuration
files provided as part of the glance packages should be used; drop
charm templates and associated code paths.

This was required in early OpenStack versions where keystone auth
credentials where rendered into the paste ini file.

Existing deployments will go through a upgrade step to replace the
previously provided paste files from the charm with those provided
by the glance-api and glance-registry packages.

Change-Id: I016b8cb7823b98e8dffa91b3b427ed88a7b619bc

commit_message:
BGP Dynamic Routing: introduce BgpDriver

This patch introduces BgpDriver interface which will be used by
the BgpDrAgent for passing BGP speaker, peer and route information
to the registered BGP driver.

In addition, this patch also implements Ryu as a reference
BGP driver for the proof of concept.

Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <ryan.tidwell@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jaume Devesa <devvesa@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If9a7e2c4c45c395b8e93bd1293667bf67f53dcfa

Fix gate scripts to use script dir for sourcing commons

The gate job calls the hook scripts directly, without
changing the current directory.  So we need to source the
commons script from the hook script directory.
Also fix typo in screen dir env var name.

subject: disable swift retry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 16:41:03.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/swift.py'], 'message': "disable swift retry

swift has native retry functionality built in and it's enabled by
default. this means every action we do, even those expected to failed,
will repeat 5 times with an additional backoff mechanism. so every
time we have a new metric, there is quite a large delay between first
attempt and confirmation that it does not exist

Change-Id: I4320fb3e8bb30603bd70f8159fbcf855fc4a2880
"}]
commit_message:
disable swift retry

swift has native retry functionality built in and it's enabled by
default. this means every action we do, even those expected to failed,
will repeat 5 times with an additional backoff mechanism. so every
time we have a new metric, there is quite a large delay between first
attempt and confirmation that it does not exist

Change-Id: I4320fb3e8bb30603bd70f8159fbcf855fc4a2880

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-08 17:10:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_aggregates.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/aggregates.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/aggregates.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Aggregate object fixups

In the original removal of DictCompat from the Aggregate object, the
aggregate.get(foo, default) calls were changed to getattr(aggregate,
foo, default). This is an incorrect change, because the default of
getattr() is only used if AttributeError is raised. The original get()
call would return the default if the variable was not set, but in order
to get the default with getattr() 'in' has to be used. So now, the
getattr() calls are changed to:

foo = aggregate.foo if 'foo' in aggregate else default

Also, a comment was added for using getattr() on all aggregate fields,
explaining we can do the getattr() and not worry about metadata being
unset, because the compute API always sets it. nova.objects.base also
has a helper method to compare the primitives of two objects to check if
they're equal, so a helper method in the tests were changed over to use
that helper method.

Change-Id: Iee651704c90fcdda0938f907924a4565399601d7
Closes-Bug: #1554617
"}]
commit_message:
Aggregate object fixups

In the original removal of DictCompat from the Aggregate object, the
aggregate.get(foo, default) calls were changed to getattr(aggregate,
foo, default). This is an incorrect change, because the default of
getattr() is only used if AttributeError is raised. The original get()
call would return the default if the variable was not set, but in order
to get the default with getattr() 'in' has to be used. So now, the
getattr() calls are changed to:

foo = aggregate.foo if 'foo' in aggregate else default

Also, a comment was added for using getattr() on all aggregate fields,
explaining we can do the getattr() and not worry about metadata being
unset, because the compute API always sets it. nova.objects.base also
has a helper method to compare the primitives of two objects to check if
they're equal, so a helper method in the tests were changed over to use
that helper method.

Change-Id: Iee651704c90fcdda0938f907924a4565399601d7
Closes-Bug: #1554617

commit_message:
Correct the wrong usage of 'format' jsonschema keyword in servers API

'format' keyword works for any types. That means for 'port' field,
'null' value never passed the format checks. We should use 'oneOf'
keyword instead of it.

Change-Id: Ic51e9e1c6efadce0a0b4d20a114ca75799fb36a5
Partial-Bug: #1552888

subject: Add ebtables to openstack_hosts role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 16:26:00.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/openstack_hosts/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add ebtables to openstack_hosts role

This change adds the ebtables package and kernel module to the
openstack_host role. This is being added because without it
the neutron linuxbridge agent will not start in a container
sighting that the ebtables filter is missing. While we do not
see this issue in the gate, because its being masked by the os_nova
role, it is a problem on a multi-node setup when using network nodes
that are not also compute nodes. With this simple change neutron had
no issues running in a true multi-node setup.

Change-Id: Ie0cad4efa2d65697a49bbb5da70a59fca85d5fa4
Backport-of: Ib178bbeed14c3e6c17613ad72545bcadf66b98cb
Closes-Bug: 1546818
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add ebtables to openstack_hosts role

This change adds the ebtables package and kernel module to the
openstack_host role. This is being added because without it
the neutron linuxbridge agent will not start in a container
sighting that the ebtables filter is missing. While we do not
see this issue in the gate, because its being masked by the os_nova
role, it is a problem on a multi-node setup when using network nodes
that are not also compute nodes. With this simple change neutron had
no issues running in a true multi-node setup.

Change-Id: Ie0cad4efa2d65697a49bbb5da70a59fca85d5fa4
Backport-of: Ib178bbeed14c3e6c17613ad72545bcadf66b98cb
Closes-Bug: 1546818
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add cron image and playbook

Add cron image and playbook for logrotate.

The "common" Ansible playbook includes configuration files for
logrotate. At this point the operator cannot customize/override the
logrotate configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1553244
Change-Id: Ic9fdda9a273c9ccd90502f0acc7614d2c7157dca

subject: Moved CORS middleware configuration into oslo-config-generator
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-09 21:02:17.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/api/app.py', 'etc/magnum/api-paste.ini', 'setup.cfg', 'magnum/common/config.py', 'magnum/common/service.py'], 'message': "Moved CORS middleware configuration into oslo-config-generator

The default values needed for magnum's implementation of cors
middleware have been moved from paste.ini into the configuration
hooks provided by oslo.config. Furthermore, these values have been
added to the default initialization procedure. This ensures
that if a value remains unset in the configuration file, it will
fallback to using sane defaults. It also ensures that an operator
modifying the configuration will be presented with that same
set of defaults.

Change-Id: I7d8f8708d53bbab117600070982ac80482fa0a77
Closes-Bug: 1551836
"}]
commit_message:
Moved CORS middleware configuration into oslo-config-generator

The default values needed for magnum's implementation of cors
middleware have been moved from paste.ini into the configuration
hooks provided by oslo.config. Furthermore, these values have been
added to the default initialization procedure. This ensures
that if a value remains unset in the configuration file, it will
fallback to using sane defaults. It also ensures that an operator
modifying the configuration will be presented with that same
set of defaults.

Change-Id: I7d8f8708d53bbab117600070982ac80482fa0a77
Closes-Bug: 1551836

subject: Upgrades: initialization command/snippet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 12:58:49.000000000', 'files': ['environments/major-upgrade-pacemaker-init.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_init.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_script_delivery.yaml'], 'message': 'Upgrades: initialization command/snippet

This allows to run a command or a script snippet on all overcloud nodes
at the beginning of the upgrade. The intended use is to switch to a new
set of repositories on the overcloud. This is done differently in
different contexts (e.g. upstream vs. downstream), but generally it
should be simple enough to not warrant creation of switchable
"UpgradeInit" resource in the resource registry, and a string
command/snippet parameter should suffice.

Change-Id: I72271170d3f53a5179b3212ec9bae9a6204e29e6
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrades: initialization command/snippet

This allows to run a command or a script snippet on all overcloud nodes
at the beginning of the upgrade. The intended use is to switch to a new
set of repositories on the overcloud. This is done differently in
different contexts (e.g. upstream vs. downstream), but generally it
should be simple enough to not warrant creation of switchable
"UpgradeInit" resource in the resource registry, and a string
command/snippet parameter should suffice.

Change-Id: I72271170d3f53a5179b3212ec9bae9a6204e29e6

Adding a heartbeat pollster to Ceilometer which will use a new method inside
libvirt inspector called 'inspect_heartbeat'.
This method will check the instance state and return a binary value:
1 if the instance state is VIR_DOMAIN_RUNNING and if not it will return 0.

blueprint instance-autorestart

Change-Id: I5057684935ad8260572b6a47724e8bd4b9ab942f
"}]
commit_message:
Support an auto restart on an instance shutdown

Adding a heartbeat pollster to Ceilometer which will use a new method inside
libvirt inspector called 'inspect_heartbeat'.
This method will check the instance state and return a binary value:
1 if the instance state is VIR_DOMAIN_RUNNING and if not it will return 0.

blueprint instance-autorestart

Change-Id: I5057684935ad8260572b6a47724e8bd4b9ab942f

subject: Fine Grained Samples and Meters Retention Policy.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-30 22:49:19.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/fine_grained_retention_policy.rst'], 'message': 'Fine Grained Samples and Meters Retention Policy.

Meters and Samples are stored in the database either for a limited amount
of time or until someone manually remove them.

The current time to live configuration does not allow to express different
time intervals for different samples of meters.

This blueprint allows such granular configurations.

Change-Id: If4c1b3db0970f31593a8f60f86387545f33ec665
'}]
commit_message:
Fine Grained Samples and Meters Retention Policy.

Meters and Samples are stored in the database either for a limited amount
of time or until someone manually remove them.

The current time to live configuration does not allow to express different
time intervals for different samples of meters.

This blueprint allows such granular configurations.

Change-Id: If4c1b3db0970f31593a8f60f86387545f33ec665

commit_message:
Ceilometer cAdvisor driver

User can delpoyed the containers with magnum. ceilometer needs to
collect the meters of these containers deployed by OpenStack. This
blueprint is used to solve this problem.

Change-Id: Id0e5824206e95b1e2ba5572b110698ee418f56d9
blueprint: ceilometer-cadvisor-driver

subject: Combine derived and heterogeneous meters
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-02 15:46:35.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/combine-derived-heterogeneous-meters.rst'], 'message': 'Combine derived and heterogeneous meters

Currently, the multi meter arithmetic transformer can be used to combine
only samples of simple and homogeneous meters.

The purpose of this spec is to enable the capability to combine
derived and heterogeneous meters, like cpu_util and memory.usage.

Change-Id: Ic7af2a249a57e014b3cedba1c42dd1da19d78ffe
'}]
commit_message:
Combine derived and heterogeneous meters

Currently, the multi meter arithmetic transformer can be used to combine
only samples of simple and homogeneous meters.

The purpose of this spec is to enable the capability to combine
derived and heterogeneous meters, like cpu_util and memory.usage.

Change-Id: Ic7af2a249a57e014b3cedba1c42dd1da19d78ffe

commit_message:
Fix sriov_iommu_check for role-based deployment

Role-based deployment does not support "shell" tasks, only "puppet".
So we need to wrap shell task into puppet Exec. We can remove it
later when role-based deployment is deprecated.

Closes-bug: #1555681
Change-Id: Ia81efb58e18385a9f7f2884412b231ddf7bca09a

commit_message:
Revert "Time to get rid of most vestiges of slave_of"

This reverts commit 0c94a5bae0aacff7fde9a9742b7d526096e51767

Removing 'slave_of' from the instance create API was a
backward incompatible change.

The parameter should be removed if/when trove has a new
version in their API, or adopts microversions.

This change depends on the change which reverts the
removal of slave_of from python-troveclient since
the tests depend on that argument being available in the
client.

Note that the tests could later be updated to no longer
use 'slave_of' to avoid a deprecation warning from the
client.

Conflicts:
        trove/tests/api/replication.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict was due to
5515c5291cc0ebacad59973c87ba696b5ffc5efa.

Depends-On: I9b3ec6c101a89f30e61fc683808506c404e5474f

Change-Id: Ib6811293d99fbc20f6a52ee10de7c98bfb682b18
Partial-Bug: #1538506

subject: Fixing mapping schema to allow local user
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-10 07:22:38.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/federation/utils.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py'], 'message': 'Fixing mapping schema to allow local user

Mapping to local user was broken since we introduced JSON schema for
mapping. That was because we've never accounted for the "type" attribute
in the "user" object. This patch add it back so that we can map a
remote user to either a local or ephemeral user.

Closes-Bug: 1555403

Change-Id: I7ae69b143e1bdade3e8ea9e2036227c7a38b3b10
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing mapping schema to allow local user

Mapping to local user was broken since we introduced JSON schema for
mapping. That was because we've never accounted for the "type" attribute
in the "user" object. This patch add it back so that we can map a
remote user to either a local or ephemeral user.

Closes-Bug: 1555403

Change-Id: I7ae69b143e1bdade3e8ea9e2036227c7a38b3b10

commit_message:
Exclude python-troveclient 2.1.0

Change a5234f0a07230e0d8195687e033adfe4cc0ad522 in python-troveclient
2.1.0 is a backward incompatible change.

Change I9b3ec6c101a89f30e61fc683808506c404e5474f reverts the
problem in the client and adds a compat shim until liberty-eol and
should be released in 2.2.0 for troveclient.

subject: Fix keystone-manage example command path
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 23:20:30.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developing.rst'], 'message': "Fix keystone-manage example command path

Whether the user is using tox or has installed keystone globally, the
keystone-manage command should already be in their path. The keystone
repo doesn't have a bin/ directory so trying to call
bin/keystone-manage from the root of the repo will result in an error.
Moreover, other references to keystone-manage in this page do not
specify a path. This patch fixes the instruction and makes it
consistent with the rest of the document.

Change-Id: I93f1aca9bdef0fa3ef4937ef616157d1e1b6fbe9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix keystone-manage example command path

Whether the user is using tox or has installed keystone globally, the
keystone-manage command should already be in their path. The keystone
repo doesn't have a bin/ directory so trying to call
bin/keystone-manage from the root of the repo will result in an error.
Moreover, other references to keystone-manage in this page do not
specify a path. This patch fixes the instruction and makes it
consistent with the rest of the document.

Change-Id: I93f1aca9bdef0fa3ef4937ef616157d1e1b6fbe9

commit_message:
Add support for the nova_api db

This change adds in the nova_api db migration that has to happen
within mitaka. This is a new required DB though the DB entry has
existed since Kilo.

Change:
  * The SHA was moved forward to the new version of nova to support
    this change. This was done independently of the rest of the stack
    to ensure functionality of this new DB.
  * An entry was added to the secrets file to support a new db user
    and password.
  * The requirements repo was rev'd forward to support the new
    requirements within nova.

Depends-On: If63b541bfaf91333ac5963d391e6058ac8254eec
UpgradeImpact
Change-Id: I711018f4f1f27d667a3dda94a01dc76616f98f4c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Make all tox targets constrained

Since lbaas gate has not switched to -constraints targets yet, we can
remove them right away.

Note: override install_command for releasenotes and cover targets since
corresponding gate jobs do not provide constraints file yet.

Change-Id: If3c143153d0a09378092791e76f1a728fb978aed

commit_message:
Give manila-image-elements its own acls

It looks like manila-image-elements was setup to inherit
ACLs from manila, but unlike the manila project,
manila-image-elements is not release managed and does not
have stable branches. Tagging should be done by the
manila-release group rather than the formal release process.

subject: Install cron job to flush keystone tokens.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-10 14:43:07.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_keystone_hooks.py', 'templates/keystone-token-flush', 'hooks/leader-elected', 'hooks/keystone_utils.py', 'hooks/keystone_hooks.py', 'unit_tests/test_keystone_contexts.py', 'hooks/keystone_context.py'], 'message': 'Install cron job to flush keystone tokens.

This change adds a cron job definition to flush the keystone tokens
once every hour. Without this, the keystone database grows unbounded,
which can be problematic in production environments.

This change introduces a new keystone-token-flush templated cron job,
which will run the keystone-manage token_flush command as the keystone
user once per hour. This change honors the use-syslog setting by
sending output of the command either to the keystone-token-flush.log
file or to the syslog using the logger exec.

Only the juju service leader will have the cron job active in order to
prevent multiple units from running the token_flush at the concurrently.

Change-Id: I21be3b23a8fe66b67fba0654ce498d62b3afc2ac
Closes-Bug: #1467832
'}]
commit_message:
Install cron job to flush keystone tokens.

This change adds a cron job definition to flush the keystone tokens
once every hour. Without this, the keystone database grows unbounded,
which can be problematic in production environments.

This change introduces a new keystone-token-flush templated cron job,
which will run the keystone-manage token_flush command as the keystone
user once per hour. This change honors the use-syslog setting by
sending output of the command either to the keystone-token-flush.log
file or to the syslog using the logger exec.

Only the juju service leader will have the cron job active in order to
prevent multiple units from running the token_flush at the concurrently.

Change-Id: I21be3b23a8fe66b67fba0654ce498d62b3afc2ac
Closes-Bug: #1467832

subject: Rename methods's name to add consistan

In the "validators.py" file, the predominant and correct naming standard
for methods to validate a field has the syntax: validate_<field's name>.

commit_message:
Rename methods's name to add consistan

In the "validators.py" file, the predominant and correct naming standard
for methods to validate a field has the syntax: validate_<field's name>.

Some methods have been renamed to follow a standard and add consistancy
in the file.

Change-Id: I1ae647136a2eb438de9c72af138bf7188b1bdf05
Closes-bug: #1554239

subject: Upgrade of Cinder block storage nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 13:16:12.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_block_storage.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker.yaml'], 'message': "Upgrade of Cinder block storage nodes

This introduces upgrades for Cinder block storage nodes. Currently
Cinder doesn't support upgrade level pinning and cannot safely deal with
version skew. This means that we have to upgrade Cinder storage nodes in
sync with controller nodes (after they were taken down for upgrade,
before they are brought back up) to ensure that Cinder services perform
AMQP communication only within the same major version of Cinder.

According to our current knowledge, Cinder block storage nodes are the
only node type that will have to be upgraded in sync with controllers.

Change-Id: Icec913c015eff744b0f31b513176b4b657df43af
(cherry picked from commit 7455f1afc3d2272a60d93672018324926c9eaa0d)
"}]
commit_message:
Upgrade of Cinder block storage nodes

This introduces upgrades for Cinder block storage nodes. Currently
Cinder doesn't support upgrade level pinning and cannot safely deal with
version skew. This means that we have to upgrade Cinder storage nodes in
sync with controller nodes (after they were taken down for upgrade,
before they are brought back up) to ensure that Cinder services perform
AMQP communication only within the same major version of Cinder.

According to our current knowledge, Cinder block storage nodes are the
only node type that will have to be upgraded in sync with controllers.

Change-Id: Icec913c015eff744b0f31b513176b4b657df43af
(cherry picked from commit 7455f1afc3d2272a60d93672018324926c9eaa0d)

This cuts the image size down alot, esspecially if there were lots of
small file deletes.

The fstrim utility is in the util-linux package and should be on
most all systems. fstrim also works with XFS, ext4, btrfs, etc

A reduction of 25% or more in size is common.

commit_message:
Use fstrim to prep the block device

This cuts the image size down alot, esspecially if there were lots of
small file deletes.

The fstrim utility is in the util-linux package and should be on
most all systems. fstrim also works with XFS, ext4, btrfs, etc
prodiving the kernel is new enough.

A reduction of 25% or more in size is common.

Change-Id: I49cd91e02f2d83d6b7799aff8c8cee03fde5a0e1

commit_message:
Use service tenant for ceilometer

Configure ceilometer to use the service tenant instead of the admin
tenant.  Using the admin tenant is not required and a security risk.

This brings the ceilometer configuration in line with the
recommendations from the official installation guide:
http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/install-guide/install/yum/content/ceilometer-controller-install.html

Change-Id: I40dd4543580332a46cde96f4bca639eb777ac7a8
Partial-Bug: #1358237
(cherry picked from commit 99b132b0ff258b1b7fc8eca0cbeec69613b59175)

With the trailing /, puppet is generating an admin endpoint that
looks like http://9.1.1.1:35357//v2.0, which causes problems when

Change-Id: Id7fd26bf6783cc6041f477670f98717b2658b964

commit_message:
Remove trailing / on keystone admin endpoint

With the trailing /, puppet is generating an admin endpoint that
looks like http://9.1.1.1:35357//v2.0, which causes problems when
the client actually tries to talk to it.

Change-Id: Id7fd26bf6783cc6041f477670f98717b2658b964

commit_message:
devstack:  release definition for lithium 0.3.4-SR4 and 0.3.5 snapshot

As Lithium 0.3.4-SR4 is released, this patch adds the definitions of
lithium 0.3.4-SR4 and 0.3.5-snapshot, removes 0.3.[0123]-snapshot
because the repo of 0.3.[0123]-snapshot in nexus were deleted.

Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <isaku.yamahata@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-08 15:47:48.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_ceph_storage.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_script_delivery.yaml'], 'message': 'Add a ceph-storage node upgrade script for the upgrade workflow

This adds delivery of an upgrade script to any ceph-storage nodes
during the script delivery that comes first during the upgrade
workflow.

The controllers have the ceph-mon whilst the ceph-osds are on the
ceph-storage nodes. The ceph-mons will be updated first as part of
the heat-driven controller upgrade, and ceph-osds on ceph nodes are
upgraded with the upgrade-non-controller.sh tripleo-common script
as with compute and swift nodes.

Also slight rename for the ObjectStorageConfig/Deployment here for
consistency.

Change-Id: I12abad5548dcb019ade9273da06fe66fd97f54cc
'}]
commit_message:
Add a ceph-storage node upgrade script for the upgrade workflow

This adds delivery of an upgrade script to any ceph-storage nodes
during the script delivery that comes first during the upgrade
workflow.

The controllers have the ceph-mon whilst the ceph-osds are on the
ceph-storage nodes. The ceph-mons will be updated first as part of
the heat-driven controller upgrade, and ceph-osds on ceph nodes are
upgraded with the upgrade-non-controller.sh tripleo-common script
as with compute and swift nodes.

Also slight rename for the ObjectStorageConfig/Deployment here for
consistency.

Change-Id: I12abad5548dcb019ade9273da06fe66fd97f54cc

revisions:

If a user creates a secret and passes in a transport key reference
that does not exist, the server responds to a 500 error. It has
been fixed to return a 400 error with a message that says transport key

Closes-Bug: #1554172

commit_message:
Fix 500 server error invalid transport key during secret creation

If a user creates a secret and passes in a transport key reference
that does not exist, the server responds to a 500 error. It has
been fixed to return a 400 error with a message that says transport key
not found.

Change-Id: I3c6dd459efc4aec611f88a73b118cd3f36444b63
Closes-Bug: #1554172

commit_message:
Remove default event handler from theme switch links

On Chrome the default <a> event handler was firing after reload()
resulting in a change of location.

This was particularly noticeable on the new angular Swift UI.

Change-Id: I5b644f3b899a5a8c598ceae7cdb76a1e9fd89ebf
Closes-Bug: 1555429

commit_message:
Change render_unsets default to False

The API WSME Types all inherit a to_dict method that accepts as a parameter
render_unsets. It is currently set to True by default but should be False for
consistency and also because it just makes better sense. This has caused some
unnecessary workarounds and work before it was known this existed.

Closes-Bug: 1555493
Change-Id: Idd21a003c0b1e3092f979013f8c19d75f17d0249

commit_message:
Manage and unmanage snapshot

Add APIs to support manage and unmanage share snapshots.
Also add support in the Generic driver.
This only supports for DHSS=False driver mode.

Add provider_location column to the share_snapshots table
to save data used to identify the snapshot on the backend.

Also need to bump microversion.

APIImpact
DocImpact
Change-Id: I87a066173c85d969607d132accd9f0e9bd49c235
Implements: blueprint manage-unmanage-snapshot

commit_message:
Removing version from setup.cfg

pbr [1] does postversioning as part of packging,
so there is no need for us to specify a version
in metadata of setup.cfg

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/pbr/

Change-Id: I90d13777bcee53a7231f1012f1ae7bbccd63f12e
Closes-Bug: #1555712

revisions:
[{'number': 34, 'created': '2016-03-09 23:27:17.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_api_spec.rb', 'examples/nova_wsgi.pp', 'metadata.json', 'manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'manifests/api.pp', 'manifests/params.pp', 'spec/acceptance/nova_wsgi_apache_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/nova_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'message': "Implement WSGI support for Nova API

* Add service_name parameter in ::nova::api with unit testing covering
  use cases.
* Add apache module to fixtures for unit testing.
* Add apache module to metadata.json.
* Add WSGI paths to ::nova::params.
* Create ::nova::wsgi::apache with unit testing covering use cases.
* Create acceptance tests to validate the transition from eventlet to
  WSGI and make sure apache is stopped in eventlet testing.
* Create examples/nova_wsgi.pp to document use cases.
* Deprecate enabled_apis as a string, to be an array later (with unit
  tests).
* Drop eventlet testing

Use-cases supported & limitations:
* All API (compute, metadata) running in eventlet and 100% backward
  compatible.

This is a first implementation that keeps the deployment simple &
backward compatible.
During this cycle, we accept enabled_apis as a string, but in N cycle, we
will make sure it's an array so we can drop all the code that sanitize
the parameter to make sure we enable the right WSGI process.

Change-Id: I3a7c6af2d81da28e41ee278f11937364536efd9e
"}]
commit_message:
Implement WSGI support for Nova API

* Add service_name parameter in ::nova::api with unit testing covering
  use cases.
* Add apache module to fixtures for unit testing.
* Add apache module to metadata.json.
* Add WSGI paths to ::nova::params.
* Create ::nova::wsgi::apache with unit testing covering use cases.
* Create acceptance tests to validate the transition from eventlet to
  WSGI and make sure apache is stopped in eventlet testing.
* Create examples/nova_wsgi.pp to document use cases.
* Deprecate enabled_apis as a string, to be an array later (with unit
  tests).
* Drop eventlet testing

Use-cases supported & limitations:
* All API (compute, metadata) running in eventlet and 100% backward
  compatible.

This is a first implementation that keeps the deployment simple &
backward compatible.
During this cycle, we accept enabled_apis as a string, but in N cycle, we
will make sure it's an array so we can drop all the code that sanitize
the parameter to make sure we enable the right WSGI process.

Change-Id: I3a7c6af2d81da28e41ee278f11937364536efd9e

This reverts commit 3c21196b3851283cf1ae2ed611f171c3da80e6a0.

commit_message:
Revert "run keystone in a wsgi process"

This reverts commit 3c21196b3851283cf1ae2ed611f171c3da80e6a0.

The commit is breaking upgrades from kilo to liberty. Apparently the migration from keystone eventlet to keystone httpd is not cleanly handled.

Change-Id: I419bcb5c57008d6dde046f4f276857af5bcf70b6

commit_message:
Add the Angular LBaaS V2 'Update Member List' Table Action

This change adds the Update Member list table action to the pool members
table.  This wizard allows you to Add or Remove members from the current list
of members associated with a particular pool.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: I640fdf2597e4a16191dbce8c20450c7c0dc882f0
