commit_message:
Support Network Aggregate Metrics for Instance

Currently, we have metrics for instance's per vnic, but don't
have aggregate metrics, this patch adds those aggregate metrics
for each instance.

Document for Ceilometer mearsurements should be updated in OpenStack
Manual.

DocImpact
Implements blueprint instance-network-aggregate-metrics

commit_message:
return useful message when database is not available

Currently, as long as there is one alive database for alarm, event
or metering, we can start ceilometer-api. But when user requests
related API, he may get error message like:
'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get_event_types'.
Only when storage backend is mysql or postgresql, user will get
correct message that database cannot be connected.

With this patch, user will get precise information indicating that
corresponding backend is not available.

Change-Id: If7538a4d5e927006b6a8ae11b32950589fa61582
Closes-Bug: #1496830

normlization occurred.

This patch changes this behavior to use consistent type checking for the

commit_message:
Use consistent type checking of project_id in API

We were using inconsistent type checking for the project_id in various
API endpoints. This could lead to erratic behavior if some API requests
specified the project_id UUID with hyphens and some without hyphens and
normlization occurred.

This patch changes this behavior to use consistent type checking for the
project_id for all API endpoints. Since this bug is a regression that is
less than 2 weeks old, I've also introduced a few unit tests which
should ensure we don't have another regression of the desired behavior
anytime soon.

Change-Id: I4c3ec52c01547196160e977029ecc5ded97c79ed
Closes-Bug: #1555401

commit_message:
Use auth plugins for keystoneclient

Construct and use auth plugins for keystoneclient rather than passing
all options to the client. This is a step towards making auth plugins
interchangeable and supporting v3 authentication.

Note that this is not the most efficient way to use a plugin but matches
the current behaviour.

Change-Id: I782c450a26be8a894428fae23d3ab071a8e383d4

subject: LVM: Support a volume-gorup on shared storage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-06 19:12:01.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_utils.py', 'cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': 'LVM: Support a volume-gorup on shared storage

Currently LVM driver uses software iSCSI target to export a
volume-group. This patch adds a feature to support a volume-group on
shared storage instead of exporting via iSCSI target. When a
volume-group on a shared storage (over fibre, iscsi or whatever) is
visible from all nodes such as a cinder node and compute nodes, these
nodes can access the volume-group simultaneously without the target.

General benefits
- Enable cinder to any kinds of shared storages without specific cinder
  driver.
- In regard to one storage, use both specific cinder driver and cinder
  shared LVM driver as the situation demands.
- Provide quicker volume and snapshot creation.

*Note that this requires a Nova libvirt LibvirtSharedLvmDriver as well.
 - https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/lvm-driver-for-shared-storage
 - https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/lvm-driver-for-shared-storage

Change-Id: I92ef1ae77c3f297abce7801909f69c907ecb0eb4
Signed-off-by: Mitsuhiro Tanino <mitsuhiro.tanino@hds.com>
Implements: blueprint lvm-driver-for-shared-storage
'}]
commit_message:
LVM: Support a volume-gorup on shared storage

Currently LVM driver uses software iSCSI target to export a
volume-group. This patch adds a feature to support a volume-group on
shared storage instead of exporting via iSCSI target. When a
volume-group on a shared storage (over fibre, iscsi or whatever) is
visible from all nodes such as a cinder node and compute nodes, these
nodes can access the volume-group simultaneously without the target.

General benefits
- Enable cinder to any kinds of shared storages without specific cinder
  driver.
- In regard to one storage, use both specific cinder driver and cinder
  shared LVM driver as the situation demands.
- Provide quicker volume and snapshot creation.

*Note that this requires a Nova libvirt LibvirtSharedLvmDriver as well.
 - https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/lvm-driver-for-shared-storage
 - https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/lvm-driver-for-shared-storage

Change-Id: I92ef1ae77c3f297abce7801909f69c907ecb0eb4
Signed-off-by: Mitsuhiro Tanino <mitsuhiro.tanino@hds.com>
Implements: blueprint lvm-driver-for-shared-storage

It turns out that the ComputeCapabilitiesFilter built-in to Nova
doesn't respect capabilities passed in scheduler_hints, so we can't
use it for predictable placement.  Adding this filter to the
undercloud Nova filter list will allow us to do so.

Instead of pulling in all of Nova as a test requirement, I've added
a fake_nova module to the source tree, which is injected as 'nova'

Change-Id: I0618a3b9e3c33af7cdc78db4b6994d463b8aeda9

commit_message:
Add capabilities filter for Nova

It turns out that the ComputeCapabilitiesFilter built-in to Nova
doesn't respect capabilities passed in scheduler_hints, so we can't
use it for predictable placement.  Adding this filter to the
undercloud Nova filter list will allow us to do so.

Instead of pulling in all of Nova as a test requirement, I've added
a fake_nova module to the source tree, which is injected as 'nova'
when unit tests are being run.  A check is included to make sure
nova isn't being imported for real, as well as a README explaining
the reasoning behind the fake_nova module.

Change-Id: I0618a3b9e3c33af7cdc78db4b6994d463b8aeda9
(cherry picked from commit f1c6ac9f2eb05064fca1cb7a92148b96068ed251)

subject: Add complex query for statistic requests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9562, 'name': 'Ildiko Vancsa', 'email': 'ildiko.vancsa@gmail.com', 'username': 'ildikov'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 14347, 'name': 'Aleksey Ripinen', 'email': 'aripinen@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aripinen'}, {'_account_id': 15843, 'name': 'Intel Hardware-Meters CI', 'email': 'ipmi-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'ipmici'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-07-16 14:26:10.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_complex_query_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/query.py'], 'message': 'Add complex query for statistic requests

Currenly in statistics request we use only simple queries.
It allows only queries with one value of filtered field.
One `resource_id` or `project_id` by query.
Otherwise the current implementation of Horizon Metering Dashboard
makes one request for every resource in new thread for creating statistics
chart. This behavior bulk the ceilometer backend with heavy process and may
be changed to one request with more flexible query.

Also we want to add ability to collect statistics by complex rules.

This CR adds complex query endpoint for statistics.
For mongodb added function that allows to work with complex query
for statistics. For this changes added tests. In next patch set the same
function will be made for mysql.

This CR may improve user experience and simplify current UI implementation.

Change-Id: Ib0c963fd8370792ec3ccb9a120c6306165976dab
'}]
commit_message:
Add complex query for statistic requests

Currenly in statistics request we use only simple queries.
It allows only queries with one value of filtered field.
One `resource_id` or `project_id` by query.
Otherwise the current implementation of Horizon Metering Dashboard
makes one request for every resource in new thread for creating statistics
chart. This behavior bulk the ceilometer backend with heavy process and may
be changed to one request with more flexible query.

Also we want to add ability to collect statistics by complex rules.

This CR adds complex query endpoint for statistics.
For mongodb added function that allows to work with complex query
for statistics. For this changes added tests. In next patch set the same
function will be made for mysql.

This CR may improve user experience and simplify current UI implementation.

Change-Id: Ib0c963fd8370792ec3ccb9a120c6306165976dab

subject: Start shift to symbol nomenclature
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-01-04 23:49:00.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_storage.py', 'taskflow/task.py', 'taskflow/atom.py'], 'message': 'Start shift to symbol nomenclature

Instead of referring to argument mappings and result
mappings names just refer to these as (unbound) symbols
required by atoms that are produced by atoms as (bound)
symbols which are later consumed by other atoms.

To start the transition to those concepts adjust some
of the comments, method names and strings to use the
more commonly understood symbol definitions instead of
the prior convention.

Once completed this nomenclature shift will create a more
unified set of terms and terminology that can be used throughout
taskflow to make it easier to understand the comments, docs,
examples and code...

Part of blueprint nomenclature-using-symbols

Change-Id: I15515c84ae39f001724c0598fcf2606a508bb0b9
'}]
commit_message:
Start shift to symbol nomenclature

Instead of referring to argument mappings and result
mappings names just refer to these as (unbound) symbols
required by atoms that are produced by atoms as (bound)
symbols which are later consumed by other atoms.

To start the transition to those concepts adjust some
of the comments, method names and strings to use the
more commonly understood symbol definitions instead of
the prior convention.

Once completed this nomenclature shift will create a more
unified set of terms and terminology that can be used throughout
taskflow to make it easier to understand the comments, docs,
examples and code...

Part of blueprint nomenclature-using-symbols

Change-Id: I15515c84ae39f001724c0598fcf2606a508bb0b9

commit_message:
Add a symbol type (WIP)

A symbol type will be useful for more advanced operation on
input and output symbols and allows for providing the symbols
that identify dependencies to also carry attributes which we can
use to infer additional logic/capabilities of those symbols.

In resource get_all request result resources are sorted
descending by user id, project id and last sample timestamp id.
But if we have too much data in resources collection we

Sources are dropped because they are not used.

'}]
commit_message:
Indexes changes in mongodb

In resource get_all request result resources are sorted
descending by user id, project id and last sample timestamp id.
But if we have too much data in resources collection we
will get the error. So we need compound index in resource
collection.
Sources are dropped because they are not used.

Change-Id: I9e02e6e61234b862ce4bf0b62fea72d8d061579e
Partial-Bug: #1433924

subject: Separates event listener from sample listener
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-30 14:59:24.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/test_notification.py', 'ceilometer/notification.py'], 'message': 'Separates event listener from sample listener

As many listeners were created as number of
messaging_urls. When the sample pipeline is
refreshed, the listeners are restarted, thus
interrupting both sample and event consumption.

This fix separates event listener from sample
listener, so that a refresh of a pipeline results
in restart of only the specific listener that uses
the refreshed pipeline.

Change-Id: I5551f71ac33478bca5fff5fd3a99e520fd79fbd7
Closes-Bug: 1477321
'}]
commit_message:
Separates event listener from sample listener

As many listeners were created as number of
messaging_urls. When the sample pipeline is
refreshed, the listeners are restarted, thus
interrupting both sample and event consumption.

This fix separates event listener from sample
listener, so that a refresh of a pipeline results
in restart of only the specific listener that uses
the refreshed pipeline.

Change-Id: I5551f71ac33478bca5fff5fd3a99e520fd79fbd7
Closes-Bug: 1477321

commit_message:
Fix database purge query

Fix raw_template purge query on MySQL, and handle stack tags before
removing stacks. This also removes a bunch of race conditions where we
deleted incorrect data.

Change-Id: I7b7a1d94acefbaeeed86f1833c979819361c8988
Closes-Bug: #1524387
(cherry picked from commit 6cece5bb7e9e10dfb33596c32319e7ad9b81fbff)

commit_message:
Samples with last timestamp in sqlalchemy backend

Samples with last timestamp are excluded from statistics output
when last period end equals timestamp end. This patch fix this
problem.

Change-Id: Ic97118fbf1747de7812b5c8b919ad9809a34c475
Closes-Bug: #1463368

commit_message:
Allow admin_url to be configured independently of internal

Some administrators want to configure the management endpoint to be on a
separate interface to the internal address. This change adds a separate
variable for the admin_address, defaulting to the internal_address to
preserve existing behaviour.

Change-Id: Ida5ac5bb444183db0a1b5f502b3ba336ef492512
Closes-Bug: #1535333

commit_message:
[Ironic]Match vif-pif mac address before setting 'vif_port_id'

When booting an ironic instance with multi networks, the ironic port
'vif_port_id' may mismatch with the corresponding neutron port.

Closes-Bug: #1549068
Co-Authored-By: Sivaramakrishna Garimella (sivaramakrishna.garimella@hp.com)

Change-Id: Id5f033136283987eef8de4ce2f6be256e48cdbf8
(cherry picked from commit e147a63cb396ebaadd7c841a305cf3a52be1d373)

subject: Cap cliff-tablib <2.0 in stable/kilo
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 17776, 'name': 'Reedip', 'email': 'reedip.banerjee@gmail.com', 'username': 'Reedip'}, {'_account_id': 18085, 'name': 'Yi Zhao', 'email': 'zhaoyi_yewu@cmss.chinamobile.com', 'username': 'willyzhao'}, {'_account_id': 18088, 'name': 'Bao Fangyan', 'email': 'baofangyan@cmss.chinamobile.com', 'username': 'claire1006'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-26 10:40:03.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Cap cliff-tablib <2.0 in stable/kilo

cliff-tablib 2.0 which drops JSON/YAML formatters was released
to avoid duplicated JSON formatter problem in cliff >=1.15.0 and
cliff-tablib (bug 1531574).

Kilo uses cliff<1.11.0,>=1.10.0 and in this version of cliff JSON/YAML
formatters are provided by cliff-tablib. If cliff-tablib 2.0 is used,
users cannot use JSON and YAML formatters (bug 1538044).
To deal with this problem, we need to cap cliff-tablib to <2.0.

cliff-tablib 1.1 is used in upper-constraints.txt, so there is
no change required.

This affects Kilo version of cliff-based pythonclient including
python-neutronclient and python-openstackclient.
Note that this does not affect Liberty and Mitaka.

Change-Id: I4954188c24517642a4d57db389c0511b32a0a095
Closes-Bug: #1538044
Related-Bug: #1531574
'}]
commit_message:
Cap cliff-tablib <2.0 in stable/kilo

cliff-tablib 2.0 which drops JSON/YAML formatters was released
to avoid duplicated JSON formatter problem in cliff >=1.15.0 and
cliff-tablib (bug 1531574).

Kilo uses cliff<1.11.0,>=1.10.0 and in this version of cliff JSON/YAML
formatters are provided by cliff-tablib. If cliff-tablib 2.0 is used,
users cannot use JSON and YAML formatters (bug 1538044).
To deal with this problem, we need to cap cliff-tablib to <2.0.

cliff-tablib 1.1 is used in upper-constraints.txt, so there is
no change required.

This affects Kilo version of cliff-based pythonclient including
python-neutronclient and python-openstackclient.
Note that this does not affect Liberty and Mitaka.

Change-Id: I4954188c24517642a4d57db389c0511b32a0a095
Closes-Bug: #1538044
Related-Bug: #1531574

commit_message:
use precise marker function for log message translation

According to guidelines http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html
we can/should use _LI, _LW, _LE, _LC for different log level messages
to lower translation burden.

This patch adds hacking checks to follow i18n's guide, and fixes some
string interpolation issues for log messages.

Change-Id: Idcd4775e70b28279d4022451e70d9671c187846c

commit_message:
Check triple double quotes are used in docstrings

Currently there are no check the rule:
https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0257/:
For consistency, always use """triple double quotes"""
around docstrings. This patchset adds this check.

Change-Id: Ib1008ec1d0e4956f89bc661146a0ac2bb3e80b11

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-05 11:22:58.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/pipeline_base.py', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'ceilometer/transformer/conversions.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'add metadata_updater transformer

There is a scenario that our end user wants to show resources/meters
by categories, for example, show resources/meters in Nova services.

It is hard to do it by using currect interfaces, because there is no
such field can be used.

Changing source of sample is one solution but needs to modify source
code and it is hard to meet different deployments.

This patch provides a way by configuring in pipeline to append or update
some metadata fields to samples, then we can request resources via query
field such as metadata.belong=nova to get some specific resources.

Change-Id: Ib0dc6116472b8fe2f4d2fe2a7e1b6fca8dfdd6af
'}]
commit_message:
add metadata_updater transformer

There is a scenario that our end user wants to show resources/meters
by categories, for example, show resources/meters in Nova services.

It is hard to do it by using currect interfaces, because there is no
such field can be used.

Changing source of sample is one solution but needs to modify source
code and it is hard to meet different deployments.

This patch provides a way by configuring in pipeline to append or update
some metadata fields to samples, then we can request resources via query
field such as metadata.belong=nova to get some specific resources.

Change-Id: Ib0dc6116472b8fe2f4d2fe2a7e1b6fca8dfdd6af

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4491, 'name': 'Lianhao Lu', 'email': 'lianhao.lu@intel.com', 'username': 'lianhao-lu'}, {'_account_id': 6676, 'name': 'zqfan', 'email': 'aji.zqfan@gmail.com', 'username': 'aji-zqfan'}, {'_account_id': 7049, 'name': 'Kai Qiang Wu(Kennan)', 'email': 'wkq5325@gmail.com', 'username': 'Kennan'}, {'_account_id': 7729, 'name': 'Ilya Tyaptin', 'email': 'ityaptin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ityaptin'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9459, 'name': '.Haifeng Yan', 'email': 'yanheven@qq.com', 'username': 'yan'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 12260, 'name': 'Kurt Rao', 'email': 'dingyuan.rao@gmail.com', 'username': 'kurtrao'}, {'_account_id': 12952, 'name': 'ice yao', 'email': 'yao3690093@gmail.com', 'username': 'xiabing.yao'}, {'_account_id': 14084, 'name': 'Einst Crazy', 'email': 'yu.changcai@99cloud.net', 'username': 'Einst'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-12 08:54:48.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/virt/vmware/inspector.py', 'ceilometer/tests/compute/virt/vmware/test_inspector.py'], 'message': 'Correctly handle vmware performance query errors

When performance query for certain meter fails in vsphere, it reports
"-1" in the value. As a result, ceilometer will take -1 as the volume of
the meter, which is incorrect and misleading.

1, An exception will be raised when vm is not "active".
2, If one disk or one nic is error, the "-1" will be replaced by "0" so
that the total IO rates are not effected.
3, When cpu_util and memory.usage is error, an exception will be raised
and the sample will not be generated.

Closes-Bug: #1404192
Change-Id: I29d071b79d5b5a8d37f520b2209683ca249081a8
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly handle vmware performance query errors

When performance query for certain meter fails in vsphere, it reports
"-1" in the value. As a result, ceilometer will take -1 as the volume of
the meter, which is incorrect and misleading.

1, An exception will be raised when vm is not "active".
2, If one disk or one nic is error, the "-1" will be replaced by "0" so
that the total IO rates are not effected.
3, When cpu_util and memory.usage is error, an exception will be raised
and the sample will not be generated.

Closes-Bug: #1404192
Change-Id: I29d071b79d5b5a8d37f520b2209683ca249081a8

commit_message:
Use urlunparse to reconstruct base_url

Using string replace to replace the new path back onto the old path
fails when there is no path setup in the catalog initially. Instead of
this lets use the inverse to the urlparse previously performed.

Change-Id: I931f0c558aafc8dfaa5519744c6e4e7fcffc3205
Closes-Bug: #1552475

commit_message:
Grab upper-constaints file for oslo master jobs

Looks like there were changes in the CI system which we
need to catch up with:
http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/periodic-nova-py27-with-oslo-master/bc1a2b8/console.html#_2016-03-10_06_04_18_695

Essentially, run-tox.sh sets the UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE
variable and the tox.ini of the projects uses it. We
need to make sure we fetch the file to where
UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE points to.

Change-Id: I48a75ab3b98ab439faf1479653280a8e683ef7bd

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-09-13 12:57:07.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_list_events_scenarios.py'], 'message': "Record and check insertion time, rather than mocking

Some storage systems may record their own recorded_at timestamp,
which can't easily be mocked.  So, instead record the timestamp
on the client, and validate that recorded_at matches within a skew.

This might fail if running on a remote database with a mismatched time,
though we expect most unit tests to run on a single machine.

Change-Id: If4f252485e52873363550800a9a8ec5cf16f2770
"}]
commit_message:
Record and check insertion time, rather than mocking

Some storage systems may record their own recorded_at timestamp,
which can't easily be mocked.  So, instead record the timestamp
on the client, and validate that recorded_at matches within a skew.

This might fail if running on a remote database with a mismatched time,
though we expect most unit tests to run on a single machine.

Change-Id: If4f252485e52873363550800a9a8ec5cf16f2770

commit_message:
Don't setup ARP protection on OVS for network ports

Skip adding ARP spoofing protection on OVS ports with a
device_owner field starting with 'network:'. This is
already the case for the other iptables-based spoofing
protection and is necessary for floating IPs to function
correctly on router gateway ports.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_flows.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py

Closes-Bug: #1487338
Change-Id: I32cef17ff47fd62e6db16b9083104f07239be25f
(cherry picked from commit da1ac497d2d10d008925311e3f14e9750f7b86b2)

commit_message:
Introduced command 'redeploy-changes'

The command 'redeploy-changes' allows to apply the changes
to the cluster which is in the operational state.
This allows you to deploy the changes without the
reprovisioning procedure.

Example: `fuel redeploy-changes --env <env_id>`

Partial-Bug: 1540558
Change-Id: Ida0c24075a3deeb1635f579ec00728434bc7a6d6
Depends-On: Ibc89fdbfbd0a36a890412cd8e861d35bcf930690

commit_message:
Creates Certificate and KMIP credential object

Adds Certificate as possible credential object
when using Castellan. Also adds kmip as a separate key
manager section inside the default conf file.
Tests are also added for the new credential object.
This is one of 2 patches needed to implement the
KMIP key manager. The second patch will include the
actual KMIP key manager, tests, and more documentation.

Change-Id: Id1b2ab9f1b0317585af6410f4711dd5201825c85
Partially-Implements: blueprint kmip-key-manager

commit_message:
keystone/wsgi: bind on local IP

Instead of using default value from puppetlabs-apache and use 0.0.0.0
binding, let's use local IP like it was done before when running
eventlet.

Also cleaning some useless parameters for keystone binding, that are not
used anymore since we run WSGI.

Change-Id: Id84b05e7a855d1452236c89224eed507c58b03a8

commit_message:
Add documentation for the IPMITool driver

This patch is adding the documentation for the IPMITool driver. This
covers some general overview, basic setup (prerequisites, how to enable)
as well as some advanced topics such as single/double bridge and protocol
version.

The IPMITool driver is rich and allows a lot of configuration, therefore
not all topics are addressed by this commit. TODOs were left in the
documentation (as comments) so we don't forget to address them later.

Partial-Bug: #1468710
Change-Id: Ife99de75a42d7048fd1ad31e220b5606a8fe81f0

subject: Build AFS RPMs for Centos7 periodically
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-09 23:00:47.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/infra.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Build AFS RPMs for Centos7 periodically

Create a local CentOS7 AFS repo built from upstream.  The idea is to
have this consumed by puppet-afs on a CentOS7 wheel-build host, so it
can publish wheels to the mirrors.

Some motiviations:

 * There is no official/canonical centos7 AFS rpms provided by either
   Centos or AFS [1]

 * making puppet-afs do this is another option.  However, it means
   that any non-puppet consumers have to figure this out for
   themselves, and we need to figure out how to make puppet download
   source, build and install.  This just creates a simple "add repo +
   install" path, which is much simpler for puppet consumers and
   everyone else.

 * There are some less-offical builds around.  If we build the rpms,
   we control the versions and code that goes into them, and have our
   own logs for posterity/debugging.

 * If official repos become available, it's a simple switch and we
   remove this job.

[1]  https://lists.centos.org/pipermail/centos-devel/2015-August/013730.html

Change-Id: I53e8267b2a0fc31589dd3a1f3e3f3a86175a2e15
'}]
commit_message:
Build AFS RPMs for Centos7 periodically

Create a local CentOS7 AFS repo built from upstream.  The idea is to
have this consumed by puppet-afs on a CentOS7 wheel-build host, so it
can publish wheels to the mirrors.

Some motiviations:

 * There is no official/canonical centos7 AFS rpms provided by either
   Centos or AFS [1]

 * making puppet-afs do this is another option.  However, it means
   that any non-puppet consumers have to figure this out for
   themselves, and we need to figure out how to make puppet download
   source, build and install.  This just creates a simple "add repo +
   install" path, which is much simpler for puppet consumers and
   everyone else.

 * There are some less-offical builds around.  If we build the rpms,
   we control the versions and code that goes into them, and have our
   own logs for posterity/debugging.

 * If official repos become available, it's a simple switch and we
   remove this job.

[1]  https://lists.centos.org/pipermail/centos-devel/2015-August/013730.html

Change-Id: I53e8267b2a0fc31589dd3a1f3e3f3a86175a2e15

commit_message:
Synchronize with global requirements

This patch  allignes both versions and order of packages in requirements.txt
and test-requirements.txt with master revision of OpenStack's global
requirements in Mitaka release cycle.

In order to perform the soft sync all settings from setup.py were moved to
setup.cfg and setup.py was autogenerated using cookiecutter and the default
project template for OpenStack projects.

Partial-bug: #1469045
Change-Id: I9d99517b9016f61904ab5e25d8ffb39cfb0c1119

Nova API validation changes [1] appear to have broken the
'os aggregate create' and 'nova aggregate-create' commands when

name in order to unblock the osc gate while nova investigates

commit_message:
Fix test_aggregate functional test

Nova API validation changes [1] appear to have broken the
'os aggregate create' and 'nova aggregate-create' commands when
an availability zone name is not specified. This patch set updates
the test_aggregate functional test to set the availability zone
name in order to unblock the osc gate while nova investigates
the issue.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281143/

Change-Id: I00b497be61c4bc4bc467c66c1e49b2e0636ab841
Related-Bug: #1541691

commit_message:
Use pymysql database driver for OpenStack DBs

PyMySQL is a new driver introduced in Liberty.
This patch change the MySQL url to use mysql+pymysql like recommanded.

commit_message:
Update python-troveclient deliverable for mitaka

Version 2.1.0 of the python-troveclient included a change that broke
compatibility. This change is to request that 2.1.1 (which has the fix
for the compatibility) be released with Mitaka.

This however is subject to the fact that Trove has a change that was
granted an FFE, and that change has a client side component. That
change (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/290177/) will land and then I
will request 2.2.0 be tagged.

Change-Id: I5f113c7e4a3af50b34c1cceb542ffc5a71d9395c
Related-Bug: #1538506

commit_message:
OVS Agent extension for bagpipe driver

This change introduces an OVS L2 agent extension that will now be used
instead of the previous agent in ovs_bagpipe_neutron_agent.py which
was inheriting from the Neutron OVS agent in a crude way, requiring
duplicating the main() code.

We also remove mention of the old bagpipe-openvswitch agent
in the documentation and and adapt the devstack plugin so that
old local.conf will still work.

Change-Id: Ibf27e2b028efffa1e49207d39bfc9b13464180ad
Closes-Bug: 1492021
Closes-Bug: 1531459

commit_message:
Use pkg_resources to get version

Current osprofiler can't show version due to
wrong way to generate module version.
Use pkg_resources to get version.

Note: we don't want to usr pbr in runtime.

Closes-Bug: #1551079

subject: Use SensitiveStringField for BlockDeviceMapping.connection_info
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-05 18:44:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/block_device.py', 'nova/objects/fields.py'], 'message': "Use SensitiveStringField for BlockDeviceMapping.connection_info

bd977f400a1192d5cf7c2b52ef91615c0828813c added the SensitiveStringField
to oslo.versionedobjects. SensitiveStringField is a StringField, which
is what BlockDeviceMapping.connection_info was already using. The difference
is that a SensitiveStringField masks passwords in the 'stringify' method,
which is what's used when __repr__ is called on the object.

Since BDM.connection_info can contain credentials, and the connection_info
dict gets passed around quite a bit in the compute manager and virt drivers,
it has from time to time gotten logged without first masking passwords.

This makes the object handle masking the password so we don't have to do it
explicitly anymore.

There is no version bump on the BlockDeviceMapping object since nothing has
functionally changed.

Change-Id: I66a0b5f6834034e2fcbefc4510e3aa018edec310
Closes-Bug: #1321785
"}]
commit_message:
Use SensitiveStringField for BlockDeviceMapping.connection_info

bd977f400a1192d5cf7c2b52ef91615c0828813c added the SensitiveStringField
to oslo.versionedobjects. SensitiveStringField is a StringField, which
is what BlockDeviceMapping.connection_info was already using. The difference
is that a SensitiveStringField masks passwords in the 'stringify' method,
which is what's used when __repr__ is called on the object.

Since BDM.connection_info can contain credentials, and the connection_info
dict gets passed around quite a bit in the compute manager and virt drivers,
it has from time to time gotten logged without first masking passwords.

This makes the object handle masking the password so we don't have to do it
explicitly anymore.

There is no version bump on the BlockDeviceMapping object since nothing has
functionally changed.

Change-Id: I66a0b5f6834034e2fcbefc4510e3aa018edec310
Closes-Bug: #1321785

subject: Fix oslo master jobs failures - missing upper constraints
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 14:04:36.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix oslo master jobs failures - missing upper constraints

Looks like there were changes in the CI system which we
need to catch up with:
http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/periodic-nova-py27-with-oslo-master/bc1a2b8/console.html#_2016-03-10_06_04_18_695

the failure is because UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
set in run-tox.sh and we need to switch to
zuul-git-branch-prep-upper-constraints so that
the upper-constaints.txt is fetched.

Change-Id: I8a8b4a7da838c62be6b42500b2167d63a553035e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix oslo master jobs failures - missing upper constraints

Looks like there were changes in the CI system which we
need to catch up with:
http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/periodic-nova-py27-with-oslo-master/bc1a2b8/console.html#_2016-03-10_06_04_18_695

the failure is because UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
set in run-tox.sh and we need to switch to
zuul-git-branch-prep-upper-constraints so that
the upper-constaints.txt is fetched.

Change-Id: I8a8b4a7da838c62be6b42500b2167d63a553035e

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 18675, 'name': 'Sharath Rao', 'email': 'sharath.rao@ericsson.com', 'username': 'sharath.rao'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-09 14:07:14.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_object_storage.sh'], 'message': 'Upgrades: object storage node upgrade fix

The variables in the heredoc should be escaped because they should
evaluate only when the inner script runs, not when the outer "writer"
script runs.

Python-zaqarclient is installed for os-collect-config to work, as we do
on the other node types.

Swift-proxy is removed from list of services to stop/start, as
swift-proxy isn't supposed to run on the swift storage nodes.

Change-Id: I8426b859d11378ebdc3da94dcc090133dab0c628
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrades: object storage node upgrade fix

The variables in the heredoc should be escaped because they should
evaluate only when the inner script runs, not when the outer "writer"
script runs.

Python-zaqarclient is installed for os-collect-config to work, as we do
on the other node types.

Swift-proxy is removed from list of services to stop/start, as
swift-proxy isn't supposed to run on the swift storage nodes.

Change-Id: I8426b859d11378ebdc3da94dcc090133dab0c628

subject: Fixup systemctl_swift stop/start  during the controller upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 10:25:29.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_common_functions.sh'], 'message': 'Fixup systemctl_swift stop/start  during the controller upgrade

During the controller upgrade in
major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh we use systemctl to stop
all swift services and then start them again in _pacemaker_2.sh

In the case of stand-alone swift nodes the deployer may have
used the ControllerEnableSwiftStorage: false so that only the
swift-proxy service is left on controllers (wrt swift). The
systemctl_swift function used during upgrades is changed to factor
this in.

Change-Id: Ib22005123429f250324df389855d0dccd2343feb
(cherry picked from commit 9727a27d00bbc423b565e02d2d69cc3d74f96761)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixup systemctl_swift stop/start  during the controller upgrade

During the controller upgrade in
major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh we use systemctl to stop
all swift services and then start them again in _pacemaker_2.sh

In the case of stand-alone swift nodes the deployer may have
used the ControllerEnableSwiftStorage: false so that only the
swift-proxy service is left on controllers (wrt swift). The
systemctl_swift function used during upgrades is changed to factor
this in.

Change-Id: Ib22005123429f250324df389855d0dccd2343feb
(cherry picked from commit 9727a27d00bbc423b565e02d2d69cc3d74f96761)

commit_message:
Properly retrieve keystone user from admin client

When using sessions, we need to get the user from the session instead of
the auth plugin directly. This fixes an issue when creating alarms with
trusts.

Change-Id: I03cdabb9c2065414ef411b1a9b9b455a636004ac
Closes-Bug: #1555529

subject: Upgrades: install zaqarclient
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 10:52:03.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_compute.sh'], 'message': "Upgrades: install zaqarclient

Old overcloud images don't have python-zaqarclient installed, and new
overclouds' os-collect-config are configured with Zaqar support. This
together means that on upgrade we need to install python-zaqarclient,
otherwise os-collect-config will be restarted during yum update and
crash due to trying to import missing Python module from zaqarclient.

Change-Id: I3e875e14cb60b1b78aec0d9ddc412ccf865abd01
(cherry picked from commit f496aa225c2f12e2f8da80c74d4b511e0e6e2bf0)
"}]
commit_message:
Upgrades: install zaqarclient

Old overcloud images don't have python-zaqarclient installed, and new
overclouds' os-collect-config are configured with Zaqar support. This
together means that on upgrade we need to install python-zaqarclient,
otherwise os-collect-config will be restarted during yum update and
crash due to trying to import missing Python module from zaqarclient.

Change-Id: I3e875e14cb60b1b78aec0d9ddc412ccf865abd01
(cherry picked from commit f496aa225c2f12e2f8da80c74d4b511e0e6e2bf0)

subject: Fix HNAS driver crash with unmounted filesystems
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 19:39:23.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/hitachi/test_hds_hnas.py', 'manila/share/drivers/hitachi/hds_hnas.py'], 'message': 'Fix HNAS driver crash with unmounted filesystems

HNAS driver does not verify if the filesystem is mounted when
updating the backend capabilities, which causes it to crash when
the configured filesystem is not mounted. Fixed this issue by
verifying and mounting the filesystem before updating the
capabilities.

Change-Id: Ief64ba87b54ba8b6f7137836343d285ef4c76ce8
Closes-bug: #1555302
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HNAS driver crash with unmounted filesystems

HNAS driver does not verify if the filesystem is mounted when
updating the backend capabilities, which causes it to crash when
the configured filesystem is not mounted. Fixed this issue by
verifying and mounting the filesystem before updating the
capabilities.

Change-Id: Ief64ba87b54ba8b6f7137836343d285ef4c76ce8
Closes-bug: #1555302

commit_message:

The trove image is one of the larger ones we cache, and after
double-checking it is still used as part of the
gate-tempest-dsvm-trove tests (although integration tests seem use

We added this flag because there were unreleased changes in glean that

commit_message:
Remove Fedora23 install-glean-from-git flag

We added this flag because there were unreleased changes in glean that
we needed (glean is installed by simple-init element).  These are now
released, so revert back to using the default release version.

Change-Id: I660be83608a91af33e3241333df9e43d67dd1f16

commit_message:
Remove redundant Manila Tempest job

Tempest job called 'gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron' runs
the same set of tests as 'gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron-postgres'
but using different DB backend. So, delete it as redundant to
reduce amount of used CI resources.

Change-Id: Ia80c0cb2785e4829abc2323ca4ce0145aef90e26

commit_message:
Add serialization of SR-IOV info for orchestrator

Add "add-port" transformations for SR-IOV enabled NICs (with
SR-IOV properties and no bridge).

Add list of PCI-IDs of all SR-IOV enabled NICs in cluster into
"quantum_settings.supported_pci_vendor_devs" for every node in cluster.

'physnet' is now changeable through API.

Change-Id: Ic4a38ca03b90ee18a06f85df6959242a39d035c1
Implements: blueprint support-sriov

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 10:36:19.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': 'Ironic: Set DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME to full disk image for agent

The agent_* drivers in Ironic are not yet capable of deploying partition
images. The code in DevStack was aware of that but it was looking at the
agent_ssh driver specifically.

This patch is fixing this assumption and extending that conditional for
all agent drivers.

Change-Id: I416faa9ef6fba9621cd664d5a0747b1e80e281d1
'}]
commit_message:
Ironic: Set DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME to full disk image for agent

The agent_* drivers in Ironic are not yet capable of deploying partition
images. The code in DevStack was aware of that but it was looking at the
agent_ssh driver specifically.

This patch is fixing this assumption and extending that conditional for
all agent drivers.

Change-Id: I416faa9ef6fba9621cd664d5a0747b1e80e281d1

commit_message:
Reduce max-servers for tripleo rh1

In order to make them bigger, we've reduced the number
of testenvs available for CI jobs. To reduce the
possibility of jenkins salves waiting too long for testenv's
we should reduce the number of jenkins saves also. Jobs will
then wait in the ZUUL queue where they wont timout.

Change-Id: I0a146fe519598f6123cb7916e5238c8d66351628

build memcached if deemed necessary.

subject: Fuel version from cluster used in OSWL reports
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8931, 'name': 'Artem Roma', 'email': 'aroma@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aateem'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 18205, 'name': 'Bulat Gaifullin', 'email': 'gaifullinbf@gmail.com', 'username': 'bgaifullin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 10:20:18.000000000', 'files': ['analytics/fuel_analytics/api/resources/utils/oswl_stats_to_csv.py', 'analytics/fuel_analytics/api/resources/utils/stats_to_csv.py', 'analytics/fuel_analytics/test/api/resources/utils/test_oswl_stats_to_csv.py', 'analytics/fuel_analytics/api/resources/csv_exporter.py', 'analytics/fuel_analytics/test/api/resources/utils/test_plugins_to_csv.py'], 'message': 'Fuel version from cluster used in OSWL reports

Wrong source for Fuel version was used in the OSWL report.
We used the version of Fuel installed on master node, instead of
cluster version. Thus in case of upgrade master node we had
different fuel versions in the clusters and OSWL reports for
the same master node uid.

Now we are using Fuel version from OSWL.version_info or from
the cluster data. Fuel version from cluster is used also in the
plugins report.

Change-Id: I114beae261686fb6e4d77504dd102b722a43e611
Closes-Bug: #1547565
'}]
commit_message:
Fuel version from cluster used in OSWL reports

Wrong source for Fuel version was used in the OSWL report.
We used the version of Fuel installed on master node, instead of
cluster version. Thus in case of upgrade master node we had
different fuel versions in the clusters and OSWL reports for
the same master node uid.

Now we are using Fuel version from OSWL.version_info or from
the cluster data. Fuel version from cluster is used also in the
plugins report.

Change-Id: I114beae261686fb6e4d77504dd102b722a43e611
Closes-Bug: #1547565

Within the volume API, some functions are wrapped to translate either
volume exceptions or snapshot exceptions. Within both of those wrappers,
they check for a connection error and raise a nova
CinderConnectionFailed exception. This is now moved to a common wrapper,

Change-Id: If2b948645c3678ed35074d61dbbb24428fcf570f
Related-Bug: #1554631
'}]
commit_message:
Use generic wrapper for cinder exceptions

Within the volume API, some functions are wrapped to translate either
volume exceptions or snapshot exceptions. Within both of those wrappers,
they check for a connection error and raise a nova
CinderConnectionFailed exception. This is now moved to a common wrapper,
which both the volume and snapshot translation wrappers use.

Change-Id: If2b948645c3678ed35074d61dbbb24428fcf570f
Related-Bug: #1554631

subject: Retry tempest cirros image creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 10:32:45.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_tempest/tasks/tempest_resources.yml'], 'message': "Retry tempest cirros image creation

Creating the cirros image fails intermittently. To debug this I
increased the haproxy timeout and inserted some debug tasks into the
tempest_resources playbook. These revealed that the cause of the failure
is glance getting a 400 response from the cirros mirror when doing a
head request to ascertain the size of the image.

I cannot find fault with the OSA mechanisms and suspect the fault is an
intermittent one with the remote server. In which case we don't have
many options apart from to retry, which is what this patch does.

Cherry-Picked (ish) from:
openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/dd12087021e5611b1be4a5a8a7512257e8844ba1

Change-Id: I9e9ac72acb6c8174db733405f6b468ac8ced4573
"}]
commit_message:
Retry tempest cirros image creation

Creating the cirros image fails intermittently. To debug this I
increased the haproxy timeout and inserted some debug tasks into the
tempest_resources playbook. These revealed that the cause of the failure
is glance getting a 400 response from the cirros mirror when doing a
head request to ascertain the size of the image.

I cannot find fault with the OSA mechanisms and suspect the fault is an
intermittent one with the remote server. In which case we don't have
many options apart from to retry, which is what this patch does.

Cherry-Picked (ish) from:
openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/dd12087021e5611b1be4a5a8a7512257e8844ba1

Change-Id: I9e9ac72acb6c8174db733405f6b468ac8ced4573

commit_message:
Reload route after performing actions

This removes any special handler functions being used by some tables
and detail pages to refresh the data after performing an action and
just reloads the angular route instead. It's simpler and consistent.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: I6b696f51cf709e11bd027f8a10038874479c51db

commit_message:
Add support for Aodh alarming endpoints

Aodh is part of the OpenStack Telemetry and provides alarming and
notification services based on events across an OpenStack Cloud.

Ensure that keystone understands 'aodh' and 'alarming' as valid
endpoint types.

Change-Id: Id1d9fed86ec7af2327f2d18738703290b4f833a1

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 6794, 'name': 'Simon Pasquier', 'email': 'pasquier.simon@gmail.com', 'username': 'simon-pasquier'}, {'_account_id': 8604, 'name': 'Avi Weit', 'email': 'weit@il.ibm.com', 'username': 'weit'}, {'_account_id': 9526, 'name': 'Zi Lian Ji', 'email': 'jizilian@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jizilian'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 13248, 'name': 'Wenzhi Yu', 'email': 'wenzhi_yu@163.com', 'username': 'yuywz'}, {'_account_id': 15843, 'name': 'Intel Hardware-Meters CI', 'email': 'ipmi-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'ipmici'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-24 02:36:23.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/virt/libvirt/inspector.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/compute/virt/libvirt/test_inspector.py'], 'message': 'Correct cpu_util time collected by libvirt inspector

Currently in ceilometer.compute.virt.libvirt.inspector.inspect_cpus
method, inspector get "info.cpu_time" to calculate cpu_util of VMs.
However, "info.cpu_time" is actually the usage time of the physical
cpus on compute node, not the usage time of vcpus of VMs, please
refer to [1]. What we really need is "vcpu_info.vcpu_time".

[1] https://libvirt.org/ocaml/html/Libvirt.Domain.html

Change-Id: I22aa20c5506bec1bb830f0407ba6b652a167ed8f
Closes-Bug: #1527620
'}]
commit_message:
Correct cpu_util time collected by libvirt inspector

Currently in ceilometer.compute.virt.libvirt.inspector.inspect_cpus
method, inspector get "info.cpu_time" to calculate cpu_util of VMs.
However, "info.cpu_time" is actually the usage time of the physical
cpus on compute node, not the usage time of vcpus of VMs, please
refer to [1]. What we really need is "vcpu_info.vcpu_time".

[1] https://libvirt.org/ocaml/html/Libvirt.Domain.html

Change-Id: I22aa20c5506bec1bb830f0407ba6b652a167ed8f
Closes-Bug: #1527620

commit_message:
api: allow ssl communications with registry

Add missing options to allow Glance API to connect to Glance Registry
when SSL is enabled on both services.
Also switching SSL options to os_service_default to avoid useless
conditions in manifests.

Change-Id: Ia40228fc165ef8ce1213fed7f5eec4de1c12c013

commit_message:
unify *_kwargs name in scenarios

When running a scenario, `kwargs` is used as default key-word arguments.
But in some scenarios, there are more and one services being called, and
we use xxx_kwargs for this case.

However, some xxx_kwargs are not unifed for same usage[0]. Unifying
these could avoid midleading for end users. Another improvement is to
add xxx_kwargs with empty settings for scenario config files.

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/489505/

Change-Id: I80f49be5c1cd21812d6b2d56b0f4279f0cf4f402

subject: [CLI] Rework commands.task.TaskCommands.detailed

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-07 15:05:32.000000000', 'files': ['rally/cli/commands/task.py', 'tests/unit/cli/commands/test_task.py', 'rally/task/processing/utils.py', 'tests/unit/task/processing/test_utils.py'], 'message': '[CLI] Rework commands.task.TaskCommands.detailed

This completely reworks command "rally task detailed"
so this command processes task data in the same manner as
"rally task report".

As result, we have the following:
  * same results as in HTML report (this fixes bug #1550262)
  * using extended task results - this is what we will use
    someday in all cases instead of generic task results
  * streaming task results processing
  * code simplification - removed several single-time used
    functions in method scope
  * removed unused code from rally.task.processing.utils

Change-Id: Ifd5d09038762890c41ac89983c91d00646f81f4a
Closes-Bug: #1550262
'}]
commit_message:
[CLI] Rework commands.task.TaskCommands.detailed

This completely reworks command "rally task detailed"
so this command processes task data in the same manner as
"rally task report".

As result, we have the following:
  * same results as in HTML report (this fixes bug #1550262)
  * using extended task results - this is what we will use
    someday in all cases instead of generic task results
  * streaming task results processing
  * code simplification - removed several single-time used
    functions in method scope
  * removed unused code from rally.task.processing.utils

Change-Id: Ifd5d09038762890c41ac89983c91d00646f81f4a
Closes-Bug: #1550262

subject: [API] Extend api.Task.get_detailed
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-07 15:00:10.000000000', 'files': ['rally/api.py', 'tests/unit/test_api.py'], 'message': '[API] Extend api.Task.get_detailed

Extend api.Task.get_detailed with ability to return
task data as dict with extended results.
This change is backward compatible.

Reasons for this change:
  * current task results format is going to be deprecated
    after planned DB schema upgrade, so this patch is yet
    another step forward to this aim
  * all rally.api methods should return data only of basic
    python types, that is why task data is of dict dict
  * This change is also required by further patch

Change-Id: I9fadd08db7c3c6ed7cd5a793d4c4990b92f89d6c
'}]
commit_message:
[API] Extend api.Task.get_detailed

Extend api.Task.get_detailed with ability to return
task data as dict with extended results.
This change is backward compatible.

Reasons for this change:
  * current task results format is going to be deprecated
    after planned DB schema upgrade, so this patch is yet
    another step forward to this aim
  * all rally.api methods should return data only of basic
    python types, that is why task data is of dict dict
  * This change is also required by further patch

Change-Id: I9fadd08db7c3c6ed7cd5a793d4c4990b92f89d6c

commit_message:
Allow setting of public_addr from ::profile::mon and ::mon

To make public_addr persistent this change writes it into the
[mon.$id] section from the ::mon define.

This change also allows for configuration of public_addr from the
::profile::mon class so that it can be set via hieradata.

Change-Id: I56f969328c68ed83a9b2d54ff4254dbcd6f55de0

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-10 11:06:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/agent/_agent_manager_base.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/bridge_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_bridge_lib.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/agent/_common_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/macvtap/agent/macvtap_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/agent/test__common_agent.py'], 'message': "Check tap bridge timestamps to detect local changes

During a quick instance rebuild on Nova, it may remove a tap
interface and then plug it in within the agent polling window.
In this scenario the agent will not realize a device has changed
and will therefore not ask the server for info an subsequently
update its status. This will prevent the notification from being
sent back to Nova that the vif plugging has finished so the
VM will never resume state.

This adds a new timestamp collection method to the common agent
manager interface for devices that is used by the common agent
loop to determine if a device has locally changed.

The linux bridge implementation of it checks the timestamps on the
tap interface's 'bridge' directory, which will change whenever
the tap is added to bridge.

Closes-Bug: #1531862
Change-Id: If172470e907848556b6a8aff13520f94245919bb
"}]
commit_message:
Check tap bridge timestamps to detect local changes

During a quick instance rebuild on Nova, it may remove a tap
interface and then plug it in within the agent polling window.
In this scenario the agent will not realize a device has changed
and will therefore not ask the server for info an subsequently
update its status. This will prevent the notification from being
sent back to Nova that the vif plugging has finished so the
VM will never resume state.

This adds a new timestamp collection method to the common agent
manager interface for devices that is used by the common agent
loop to determine if a device has locally changed.

The linux bridge implementation of it checks the timestamps on the
tap interface's 'bridge' directory, which will change whenever
the tap is added to bridge.

Closes-Bug: #1531862
Change-Id: If172470e907848556b6a8aff13520f94245919bb

commit_message:
Tweak the resize_confirm_window help text

The resize_confirm_window config option is used for
both cold migration and resize (where resize is really
just cold migration with a different flavor). But
you might not know this unless you looked at the periodic
task that uses the option.

So this change updates the help text slightly to also
note that it's used for automatically confirming
cold migrations.

Change-Id: I4e21a848c4fa483b5975f6b09d6d05c161922277

commit_message:
Copy tempest.common.tempest_fixtures in to Neutron

tempest_fixtures is used exclusively in Tempest and Neutron,
therefor I don't think it makes sense to move it in to tempest.lib.
I'd rather copy it in to the Neutron repo.

Change-Id: Ibb52e2cae3f1af1569a04123c43ebc4d125e326d
Related-bug: #1555356

commit_message:
Account for oslo_config deprecation in ceilometer.conf template

Ceilometer logs are showing:
 * Option "notification_topics" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated. Use option
   "topics" from group "oslo_messaging_notifications"
 * Option "auth_plugin" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated. Use
   option "auth_type" from group "keystone_authtoken"
 * Option "username" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated. Use option
   "user-name" from group "keystone_authtoken"

Change-Id: I594a35090f7e9d3835adbae7dfdeabe07ceb7adf

subject: Account for oslo_config deprecations in aodh.conf template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 19:35:45.000000000', 'files': ['templates/aodh.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Account for oslo_config deprecations in aodh.conf template

Specific changes are based on the aodh-api log noting:
 * Option "auth_plugin" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated. Use
   option "auth_type" from group "keystone_authtoken".
 * Option "username" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated. Use option
   "user-name" from group "keystone_authtoken".

Change-Id: I295ed77d88daa1b4844eb8efde628fecdad94c03
'}]
commit_message:
Account for oslo_config deprecations in aodh.conf template

Specific changes are based on the aodh-api log noting:
 * Option "auth_plugin" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated. Use
   option "auth_type" from group "keystone_authtoken".
 * Option "username" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated. Use option
   "user-name" from group "keystone_authtoken".

Change-Id: I295ed77d88daa1b4844eb8efde628fecdad94c03

This commit updates tests/test.yml to deploy rabbitmq, keystone +
galera, and ceilometer for a functional convergence test.

We point keystone at a non-existent memcached server, but this can
be adjusted to build memcached if deemed necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1553977
Change-Id: I21d8a5548c43c96aaeaa14df6b22e28074318146

commit_message:
Enable functional convergence testing

This commit updates tests/test.yml to deploy rabbitmq, keystone +
galera, and ceilometer for a functional convergence test.

We point keystone at a non-existent memcached server, but this can
be adjusted to build memcached if deemed necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1553977
Change-Id: I21d8a5548c43c96aaeaa14df6b22e28074318146

As nova stable_api.rst indicated: As the extension will be removed
from Nove V2.1 REST API. So the concept of core API and extension
API is eliminated also. There is no difference between Nova V2.1
REST API, all of them are part of Nova stable REST API.

so we can move all extensions from contrib to core, this
patch is prelude of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285213/ and
its following patchs.

Change-Id: Ibd5df4bcc70a4b4854fd519330d89c751f7409dc

commit_message:
Prepare to move extension into core plugin

As nova stable_api.rst indicated: As the extension will be removed
from Nove V2.1 REST API. So the concept of core API and extension
API is eliminated also. There is no difference between Nova V2.1
REST API, all of them are part of Nova stable REST API.

so we can move all extensions from contrib to core, this
patch is prelude of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285213/ and
its following patchs.

Change-Id: Ibd5df4bcc70a4b4854fd519330d89c751f7409dc

commit_message:
Refactoring of code:

1) new snapshot module with code vss,
lvm and part of backup.py -
create_snapshot and remove_snapshot

This module should contain all code related shadow,
vss and any new snapshots.

2) new openstack module with code from osclient,
restore and backup (BackupOS)

This module should contain code related to cinder/nova backups

3) new utils module with code from utils, win_utils,
bandwidth, config, exec_cmd, validator, streaming

This module should containd code related to anything
that cannot be extracted to its own module

4) new test modules - snapshot, utils, openstack and apiclient.

Test scheduler daemon is now located in scheduler module.

5) Backup.py is deleted and code placed to
openstack.backup (BackupOS) and to job.BackupJob

Change-Id: I46194b40b3a65c15b6095cfb7388dcfd30d95997

commit_message:
Add support for DeployArtifactURLs

Adds a new nested stack deployment which allows operators to
opt-in to deploy tarball's and RPM packages by setting
DeployArtifactURLs as a parameter_default in a Heat
environment.

The intent is to use this setting to allow t-h-t to
transparently deploy things like tarballs of puppet modules
via a Swift Temp URL.

Change-Id: I1bad4a4a79cf297f5b6e439e0657269738b5f326
Implements: blueprint puppet-modules-deployment-via-swift
(cherry picked from commit 55054f02d77ebbca63b6fbd3eab285873452933e)

subject: Enable glance-api show_image_direct_url for COW
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 09:43:43.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable glance-api show_image_direct_url for COW

Setting `show_image_direct_url` to true allows to enable Copy-On-Write
features when using some storage backends across Nova, Cinder & Glance.
It allows for example nearly instantaneous creation of instances root
disk and volumes when using RBD as a storage backend for all projects by
using Ceph features instead of downloading from Ceph via Glance, then
convert the image, then upload to Ceph via Nova or Cinder.

Change-Id: I1f56273c6b7c8d3922799cae07a66eebc0884205
(cherry picked from commit 9c9c27e17e27c67e734c2da7519cbb1b30ce2ded)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable glance-api show_image_direct_url for COW

Setting `show_image_direct_url` to true allows to enable Copy-On-Write
features when using some storage backends across Nova, Cinder & Glance.
It allows for example nearly instantaneous creation of instances root
disk and volumes when using RBD as a storage backend for all projects by
using Ceph features instead of downloading from Ceph via Glance, then
convert the image, then upload to Ceph via Nova or Cinder.

Change-Id: I1f56273c6b7c8d3922799cae07a66eebc0884205
(cherry picked from commit 9c9c27e17e27c67e734c2da7519cbb1b30ce2ded)

subject: Revert "Time to get rid of any last vestiges of slave_of"
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-09 01:14:23.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/v1/instances.py', 'troveclient/tests/test_instances.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Time to get rid of any last vestiges of slave_of"

This reverts commit a5234f0a07230e0d8195687e033adfe4cc0ad522

The change broke trove on stable/liberty since it's a backward
incompatible change.

To avoid capping python-troveclient<2.1.0 in
stable/liberty global-requirements, we have to revert this
change, blacklist the 2.1.0 version in g-r master and
stable/liberty, and then release 2.2.0.

And the slave_of code can't be removed until the last
supported stable branch that uses it is end of life, which
is liberty-eol. For now we keep the slave_of argument in
the instance.create method, but emit a deprecation warning
if it's specified, and we never pass it to the trove API
for the create or edit operations since the API removed
slave_of in 0c94a5bae0aacff7fde9a9742b7d526096e51767.

Change-Id: I9b3ec6c101a89f30e61fc683808506c404e5474f
Partial-Bug: #1538506
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Time to get rid of any last vestiges of slave_of"

This reverts commit a5234f0a07230e0d8195687e033adfe4cc0ad522

The change broke trove on stable/liberty since it's a backward
incompatible change.

To avoid capping python-troveclient<2.1.0 in
stable/liberty global-requirements, we have to revert this
change, blacklist the 2.1.0 version in g-r master and
stable/liberty, and then release 2.2.0.

And the slave_of code can't be removed until the last
supported stable branch that uses it is end of life, which
is liberty-eol. For now we keep the slave_of argument in
the instance.create method, but emit a deprecation warning
if it's specified, and we never pass it to the trove API
for the create or edit operations since the API removed
slave_of in 0c94a5bae0aacff7fde9a9742b7d526096e51767.

Change-Id: I9b3ec6c101a89f30e61fc683808506c404e5474f
Partial-Bug: #1538506

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 6717, 'name': 'Jakub Ruzicka', 'email': 'jruzicka@redhat.com', 'username': 'jruzicka'}, {'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 7613, 'name': 'Igor Yozhikov', 'email': 'medput@gmail.com', 'username': 'iyozhikov'}, {'_account_id': 10384, 'name': 'Haïkel Guémar', 'email': 'hguemar@fedoraproject.org', 'username': 'hguemar'}, {'_account_id': 13404, 'name': 'Alberto Planas', 'email': 'aplanas@gmail.com', 'username': 'aplanas'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-09 09:01:35.000000000', 'files': ['tools/rpm-packaging-status.py'], 'message': 'Add rpm-packaging-status.py for generating reports

The added tool can generate an overview about the current state of
packaging in the rpm-packaging project.
It uses the data from https://github.com/openstack/releases
and collects the needed versions for a given release and compares
this version with the version from the .spec.j2 templates.
The tool can generate a pretty table and also html output.

Change-Id: I8eb64c7bfeb82c9c87013000b71edf8f2354c652

commit_message:
Add rpm-packaging-status.py for generating reports

The added tool can generate an overview about the current state of
packaging in the rpm-packaging project.
It uses the data from https://github.com/openstack/releases
and collects the needed versions for a given release and compares
this version with the version from the .spec.j2 templates.
The tool can generate a pretty table and also html output.

Change-Id: I8eb64c7bfeb82c9c87013000b71edf8f2354c652

subject: Upgrade of Cinder block storage nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 15:48:28.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_block_storage.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker.yaml'], 'message': "Upgrade of Cinder block storage nodes

This introduces upgrades for Cinder block storage nodes. Currently
Cinder doesn't support upgrade level pinning and cannot safely deal with
version skew. This means that we have to upgrade Cinder storage nodes in
sync with controller nodes (after they were taken down for upgrade,
before they are brought back up) to ensure that Cinder services perform
AMQP communication only within the same major version of Cinder.

According to our current knowledge, Cinder block storage nodes are the
only node type that will have to be upgraded in sync with controllers.

Change-Id: Icec913c015eff744b0f31b513176b4b657df43af
"}]
commit_message:
Upgrade of Cinder block storage nodes

This introduces upgrades for Cinder block storage nodes. Currently
Cinder doesn't support upgrade level pinning and cannot safely deal with
version skew. This means that we have to upgrade Cinder storage nodes in
sync with controller nodes (after they were taken down for upgrade,
before they are brought back up) to ensure that Cinder services perform
AMQP communication only within the same major version of Cinder.

According to our current knowledge, Cinder block storage nodes are the
only node type that will have to be upgraded in sync with controllers.

Change-Id: Icec913c015eff744b0f31b513176b4b657df43af

commit_message:
Make versioned notifications topic configurable

Currently, the topic for versioned notifier is hardcoded to
'versioned_notifications', which makes it impossible to change to
other topic as unversioned notifications do.

Change-Id: Ic45b1016f332e9fd377452b0c1950de7c6d2cad9
Closes-bug: #1551641

commit_message:
Update glance::api stores parameters

The patch to implement multiple stores configuration
changed the way that the known_stores variable works,
raplacing it with stores (a list of each store) and
default_store (the default backend store). This patch
updates these parameters to reflect that change.

Change-Id: Ia0838be44a6d91e8b9b38517262c27b8bc1ded08
Depends-on: I28a79ae36e673a3537ea16910d338666b65c80f7

Tempest can be configured to check for the presence of certain

commit_message:
Add parameter to configure enabled Sahara plugins

Tempest can be configured to check for the presence of certain
Sahara plugins (vanilla, cdh, etc.) via the
data-processing-feature-enabled/plugins variable in tempest.conf.
If the cloud has been set up with a non-default set of plugins in
sahara.conf, it is necessary to change this value, or the Tempest
run will fail.

Adding a new parameter $sahara_plugins to configure this.

Change-Id: I1f7626253728bcaf95773ef060d7a1264ae7e86f

subject: Use py2pkg() contextfunction everywhere
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 16:03:08.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/oslosphinx/oslosphinx.spec.j2', 'openstack/oslo.utils/oslo.utils.spec.j2', 'openstack/oslotest/oslotest.spec.j2', 'openstack/oslo.i18n/oslo.i18n.spec.j2', 'openstack/oslo.context/oslo.context.spec.j2', 'openstack/keystoneauth1/keystoneauth1.spec.j2', 'openstack/os-client-config/os-client-config.spec.j2', 'openstack/oslo.log/oslo.log.spec.j2', 'openstack/oslo.policy/oslo.policy.spec.j2', 'openstack/oslo.serialization/oslo.serialization.spec.j2'], 'message': 'Use py2pkg() contextfunction everywhere

mass update to get rid of old-style py2pkg filter and use
the context function instead.
Done with:

sed -i 's/\(.*\){{ \(.*\) | py2pkg }}\s\(.*\)\s\(.*\)/ \
    \1{{ py2pkg(\2, ("\3", "\4")) }}/' openstack/**/*.spec.j2
sed -i 's/\(.*\){{ \(.*\) | py2pkg }}/\1{{ py2pkg(\2) }}/' \
    openstack/**/*.spec.j2

Change-Id: Ibe80800181978ac7624d3622e0c230e0b5a0fb13
'}]
commit_message:
Use py2pkg() contextfunction everywhere

mass update to get rid of old-style py2pkg filter and use
the context function instead.
Done with:

sed -i 's/\(.*\){{ \(.*\) | py2pkg }}\s\(.*\)\s\(.*\)/ \
    \1{{ py2pkg(\2, ("\3", "\4")) }}/' openstack/**/*.spec.j2
sed -i 's/\(.*\){{ \(.*\) | py2pkg }}/\1{{ py2pkg(\2) }}/' \
    openstack/**/*.spec.j2

Change-Id: Ibe80800181978ac7624d3622e0c230e0b5a0fb13

commit_message:
Catch InUseByStore case in do_image_delete

In case do_image_delete() is called on an image that is
in use and can't be deleted by the driver a HTTPConflict
error is raised in glance. Catch this error and print a
propper error message.

Closes-Bug: #1551037

Change-Id: Id17098f27511df8e05e56b8df21e748921223bd9
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

commit_message:
controller/ceilometer: use internalURL for os endpoint type

To let ceilometer access to keystone endpoints, use internalURL instead
of publicURL for security & performances reasons.

Ceilometer services (API, agents) will use internalURL endpoint to talk
to other services (keystone, neutron, etc).

Change-Id: I4cb843400f244cd34bbae4bc76371977780c7943

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-07 06:08:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_aggregates.py', 'nova/api/validation/validators.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/api/validation/parameter_types.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/aggregates.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_api_validation.py'], 'message': "Generate better validation error message when using name regexes

There are some regexes used in the json-schema for complex string validation.
When the validation failed, json-schema lib didn't generate a useful error
info for the user, it shows the regex to the user. But regex is really
unreadable for normal user. This patch override the default FormatChecker to
support passed in custom error message. This required using custom format
checker instead of using 'pattern'.

For aggregates API, it enabled 'null' in the name input. As the 'format'
keyword works for all allowed types and name format check will only validate
string type, so this patch change the schema to use 'oneOf' keyword, then
the 'format' will only against on string type.

Change-Id: Ic0e608b8a18b635bfcd936f57f14c9f54e1ef8b4
Partial-Bug: #1541691
"}]
commit_message:
Generate better validation error message when using name regexes

There are some regexes used in the json-schema for complex string validation.
When the validation failed, json-schema lib didn't generate a useful error
info for the user, it shows the regex to the user. But regex is really
unreadable for normal user. This patch override the default FormatChecker to
support passed in custom error message. This required using custom format
checker instead of using 'pattern'.

For aggregates API, it enabled 'null' in the name input. As the 'format'
keyword works for all allowed types and name format check will only validate
string type, so this patch change the schema to use 'oneOf' keyword, then
the 'format' will only against on string type.

Change-Id: Ic0e608b8a18b635bfcd936f57f14c9f54e1ef8b4
Partial-Bug: #1541691

commit_message:
Remove state transition from active to queued

After commit Ieb03aaba887492819f9c58aa67f7acfcea81720e it is no
longer necessary to maintain a state transition from ACTIVE to
QUEUED. The only time this happened was when someone removed
the last location from an image. Since this was removed we
don't need it anymore.

Also, updates the image state transition images and docs to
represent the current state transitions.

Closes-Bug: #1555448

Change-Id: I390ae2a7110f06046f38914e946139b3b729bd2d

commit_message:
Use service tenant for ceilometer

Configure ceilometer to use the service tenant instead of the admin
tenant.  Using the admin tenant is not required and a security risk.

This brings the ceilometer configuration in line with the
recommendations from the official installation guide:
http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/install-guide/install/yum/content/ceilometer-controller-install.html

Change-Id: I40dd4543580332a46cde96f4bca639eb777ac7a8

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 12:48:09.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/extraconfig/tls/ca-inject.yaml'], 'message': "Make injected CA file readable by others

Currently the permissions for the CA file that is injected (if the
environment is set), doesn't permit users that don't belong to the group
that owns the file to read it. This is too restrictive and isn't
necessary, as the certificate should be public.

This is useful in the case where we want a service that can't read the
certificate chain (or bundle) to be able to read that CA certificate.
This is the case for the MariaDB version that is being used in CentOS
7.1 for example.

Change-Id: I6ff59326a5570670c031b448fb0ffd8dfbd8b025
(cherry picked from commit b6ee4bf4a55ab9cc1dbfd85c5dd6338fef3944ce)
"}]
commit_message:
Make injected CA file readable by others

Currently the permissions for the CA file that is injected (if the
environment is set), doesn't permit users that don't belong to the group
that owns the file to read it. This is too restrictive and isn't
necessary, as the certificate should be public.

This is useful in the case where we want a service that can't read the
certificate chain (or bundle) to be able to read that CA certificate.
This is the case for the MariaDB version that is being used in CentOS
7.1 for example.

Change-Id: I6ff59326a5570670c031b448fb0ffd8dfbd8b025
(cherry picked from commit b6ee4bf4a55ab9cc1dbfd85c5dd6338fef3944ce)

commit_message:
Set db session transaction isolation level to SERIALIZABLE

The thing is that having multiple imporperly
synchronized application thread could lead to database locks.
Let's try to use SERIALIZABLE transaction isolation level
until we fix this issue properly.

Change-Id: Ifdadca533d8c6d1510694f1933838286c00d5e62
Related-Bug: #1554319
Related-Bug: #1541005
